entry_black: Recognizing their own weakness, they always live in a group. When alone, a Staravia cries noisily.
entry_x: They maintain huge flocks, although fierce scuffles break out between various flocks.

name: Staraptor
entry_diamond: It has a savage nature. It will courageously challenge foes that are much larger.
entry_black: It never stops attacking even if it is injured. It fusses over the shape of its comb.
entry_x: The muscles in its wings and legs are strong. It can easily fly while gripping a small Pokémon.

name: Bidoof
entry_diamond: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.
entry_black: A comparison revealed that Bidoof’s front teeth grow at the same rate as Rattata’s.
entry_x: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.

name: Bibarel
entry_diamond: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.
entry_black: A river dammed by Bibarel will never overflow its banks, which is appreciated by people nearby.
entry_x: It busily makes its nest with stacks of branches and roots it has cut up with its sharp incisors.

name: Kricketot
entry_diamond: It shakes its head back to front, causing its antennae to hit each other and sound like a xylophone.
entry_black: Its legs are short. Whenever it stumbles, its stiff antennae clack with a xylophone-like sound.
entry_x: It chats with others using the sounds of its colliding antennae. These sounds are fall hallmarks.

name: Kricketune
entry_diamond: It crosses its knifelike arms in front of its chest when it cries. It can compose melodies ad lib.
entry_black: There is a village that hosts a contest based on the amazingly variable cries of this Pokémon.
entry_x: It crosses its knifelike arms in front of its chest when it cries. It can compose melodies ad lib.

name: Shinx
entry_diamond: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.
entry_black: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.
entry_x: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.
entry_sword: This Pokémon generates electricity by contracting its muscles. Excited trembling is a sign that Shinx is generating a tremendous amount of electricity.

name: Luxio
entry_diamond: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause fainting. They live in small groups.
entry_black: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.
entry_x: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause fainting. They live in small groups.
entry_sword: By joining its tail with that of another Luxio, this Pokémon can receive some of the other Luxio’s electricity and power up its own electric blasts.

name: Luxray
entry_diamond: It has eyes that can see through anything. It spots and captures prey hiding behind objects.
entry_black: It can see clearly through walls to track down its prey and seek its lost young.
entry_x: When its eyes gleam gold, it can spot hiding prey--even those taking shelter behind a wall.
entry_sword: Luxray can see through solid objects. It will instantly spot prey trying to hide behind walls, even if the walls are thick.

name: Budew
abilities: Natural Cure, Poison Point, Leaf Guard
entry_diamond: Over the winter, it closes its bud and endures the cold. In spring, the bud opens and releases pollen.
entry_black: Sensitive to changing temperature, the bud is said to bloom when it feels the sun’s warm touch.
entry_x: When it feels the sun’s warm touch, it opens its bud to release pollen. It lives alongside clear pools.
entry_sword: The pollen it releases contains poison. If this Pokémon is raised on clean water, the poison’s toxicity is increased.

name: Roserade
entry_diamond: It attracts prey with a sweet aroma, then downs it with thorny whips hidden in its arms.
entry_black: Each of its hands contains different toxins, but both hands can jab with near-fatal power.
entry_x: Luring prey with a sweet scent, it uses poison whips on its arms to poison, bind, and finish off the prey.
entry_sword: After captivating opponents with its sweet scent, it lashes them with its thorny whips.

name: Cranidos
entry_diamond: It lived in jungles around 100 million years ago. Its skull is as hard as iron.
entry_black: A lifelong jungle dweller from 100 million years ago, it would snap obstructing trees with head butts.
entry_x: It was resurrected from an iron ball-like fossil. It downs prey with its headbutts.
entry_sun: It lived in jungles around a hundred million years ago. It used its skillful headbutts to combat Aerodactyl.

name: Rampardos
entry_diamond: Its powerful head butt has enough power to shatter even the most durable things upon impact.
entry_black: If two were to smash their heads together, their foot-thick skulls would keep them from fainting.
entry_x: Its skull withstands impacts of any magnitude. As a result, its brain never gets the chance to grow.
entry_sun: The result of repeated headbutts is a skull grown thick and hard. However, its brain has shrunk in size compared with Cranidos’s.

name: Shieldon
entry_diamond: A Pokémon that lived in jungles around 100 million years ago. Its facial hide is extremely hard.
entry_black: It is outstandingly armored. As a result, it can eat grass and berries without having to fight.
entry_x: It habitually polishes its face by rubbing it against tree trunks. It is weak to attacks from behind.
entry_sun: Many fossils of this Pokémon have been found, but almost none have shown signs of damage to the face.

name: Bastiodon
entry_diamond: Any frontal attack is repulsed. It is a docile Pokémon that feeds on grass and berries.
entry_black: When they lined up side by side, no foe could break through. They shielded their young in that way.
entry_x: When they lined up side by side, no foe could break through. They shielded their young in that way.
entry_sun: While it can guard against any sort of attack from the front, it is left without recourse when attacked from behind.

name: Burmy
entry_diamond: To shelter itself from cold, wintry winds, it covers itself with a cloak made of twigs and leaves.
entry_black: Even if it is born where there are no cocooning materials, it somehow always ends up with a cloak.
entry_x: To shelter itself from cold, wintry winds, it covers itself with a cloak made of twigs and leaves.

name: Wormadam Plant
entry_diamond: When BURMY evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon’s body. The cloak is never shed.
entry_black: When evolving, its body takes in surrounding materials. As a result, there are many body variations.
entry_x: Its appearance changes depending on where it evolved. The materials on hand become a part of its body.

name: Mothim
entry_diamond: It loves the honey of flowers and steals honey collected by COMBEE.
entry_black: While it loves floral honey, it won’t gather any itself. Instead, it plots to steal some from Combee.
entry_x: It loves the honey of flowers and steals honey collected by Combee.

name: Combee
entry_diamond: A Pokémon formed by three others. It busily carries sweet floral honey to VESPIQUEN.
entry_black: The trio is together from birth. It constantly gathers honey from flowers to please Vespiquen.
entry_x: The trio is together from birth. It constantly gathers honey from flowers to please Vespiquen.
entry_sword: The members of the trio spend all their time together. Each one has a slightly different taste in nectar.

name: Vespiquen
entry_diamond: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by COMBEE.
entry_black: It releases various pheromones to make the grubs in its body do its bidding while fighting foes.
entry_x: It houses its colony in cells in its body and releases various pheromones to make those grubs do its bidding.
entry_sword: It skillfully commands its grubs in battles with its enemies. The grubs are willing to risk their lives to defend Vespiquen.

name: Pachirisu
entry_diamond: It makes fur balls that crackle with static electricity. It stores them with berries in tree holes.
entry_black: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.
entry_x: It makes fur balls that crackle with static electricity. It stores them with berries in tree holes.

name: Buizel
entry_diamond: It has a flotation sac that is like an inflatable collar. It floats on water with its head out.
entry_black: It spins its two tails like a screw to propel itself through water. The tails also slice clinging seaweed.
entry_x: It swims by rotating its two tails like a screw. When it dives, its flotation sac collapses.

name: Floatzel
entry_diamond: It floats using its well-developed flotation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.
entry_black: It is a common sight around fishing ports. It is known to rescue people and carry off prey.
entry_x: It floats using its well-developed flotation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.

name: Cherubi
entry_diamond: The small ball holds the nutrients needed for evolution. Apparently, it is very sweet and tasty.
entry_black: The small ball is not only filled with nutrients, it is also tasty. Starly try to peck it off.
entry_x: Sunlight colors it red. When the small ball is drained of nutrients, it shrivels to herald evolution.
entry_sword: It nimbly dashes about to avoid getting pecked by bird Pokémon that would love to make off with its small, nutrient-rich storage ball.

name: Cherrim
entry_diamond: It blooms during times of strong sunlight. It tries to make up for everything it endured as a bud.
entry_black: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun’s rays with its whole body.
entry_x: During times of strong sunlight, its bud blooms, its petals open fully, and it becomes very active.
entry_sword: As a bud, it barely moves. It sits still, placidly waiting for sunlight to appear.

name: Shellos
abilities: Sticky Hold, Storm Drain, Sand Force
entry_diamond: Its colors and shapes differ from region to region. In the Sinnoh region, two types are confirmed.
entry_black: Beware of pushing strongly on its squishy body, as it makes a mysterious purple fluid ooze out.
entry_x: Beware of pushing strongly on its squishy body, as it makes a mysterious purple fluid ooze out.
entry_sun: For the most part, it makes its home along the seashore. Its color and form differ according to its habitat and the quality of its food.
entry_sword: This Pokémon’s habitat shapes its physique. According to some theories, life in warm ocean waters causes this variation to develop.

name: Gastrodon
abilities: Sticky Hold, Storm Drain, Sand Force
entry_diamond: It has a pliable body without any bones. If any part of its body is torn off, it grows right back.
entry_black: Long ago, its entire back was shielded with a sturdy shell. There are traces of it left in its cells.
entry_x: When its natural enemy attacks, it oozes purple fluid and escapes.
entry_sun: It has strong regenerative capabilities. Even if parts of it are bitten off by fish Pokémon, it will return to normal within a few hours.
entry_sword: Its search for food sometimes leads it onto land, where it leaves behind a sticky trail of slime as it passes through.

name: Ambipom
entry_diamond: To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails. It rarely uses its arms now.
entry_black: Split into two, the tails are so adept at handling and doing things, Ambipom rarely uses its hands.
entry_x: They work in large colonies and make rings by linking their tails, apparently in friendship.

name: Drifloon
entry_diamond: A Pokémon formed by the spirits of people and Pokémon. It loves damp, humid seasons.
entry_black: Because of the way it floats aimlessly, an old folktale calls it a “Signpost for Wandering Spirits.”
entry_x: A Pokémon formed by the spirits of people and Pokémon. It loves damp, humid seasons.
entry_sun: Stories go that it grabs the hands of small children and drags them away to the afterlife. It dislikes heavy children.
entry_sword: Perhaps seeking company, it approaches children. However, it often quickly runs away again when the children play too roughly with it.

name: Drifblim
entry_diamond: It’s drowzy in daytime, but flies off in the evening in big groups. No one knows where they go.
entry_black: At dusk, swarms of them are carried aloft on winds. When noticed, they suddenly vanish.
entry_x: It carries people and Pokémon when it flies. But since it only drifts, it can end up anywhere.
entry_sun: There was once an incident in which a man took a trip riding a Drifblim, only to go missing.
entry_sword: Some say this Pokémon is a collection of souls burdened with regrets, silently drifting through the dusk.

name: Buneary
entry_diamond: It slams foes by sharply uncoiling its rolled ears. It stings enough to make a grown-up cry in pain.
entry_black: Its ears are always rolled up. They can be forcefully extended to shatter even a large boulder.
entry_x: Its ears are always rolled up. They can be forcefully extended to shatter even a large boulder.
entry_sword: If both of Buneary’s ears are rolled up, something is wrong with its body or mind. It’s a sure sign the Pokémon is in need of care.

name: Lopunny
entry_diamond: An extremely cautious Pokémon. It cloaks its body with its fluffy ear fur when it senses danger.
entry_black: The ears appear to be delicate. If they are touched roughly, it kicks with its graceful legs.
entry_x: Extremely cautious, it quickly bounds off when it senses danger.
entry_sword: Lopunny is constantly monitoring its surroundings. If danger approaches, this Pokémon responds with superdestructive kicks.

name: Mismagius
entry_diamond: Its cries sound like incantations. Those hearing it are tormented by headaches and hallucinations.
entry_black: Its cry sounds like an incantation. It is said the cry may rarely be imbued with happiness-giving power.
entry_x: It chants incantations. While they usually torment targets, some chants bring happiness.
entry_sun: It appears as if from nowhere—muttering incantations, placing curses, and giving people terrifying visions.

name: Honchkrow
entry_diamond: Becoming active at night, it is known to swarm with numerous MURKROW in tow.
entry_black: If one utters a deep cry, many Murkrow gather quickly. For this, it is called “Summoner of Night.”
entry_x: If one utters a deep cry, many Murkrow gather quickly. For this, it is called “Summoner of Night.”
entry_sun: A single cry from this nocturnal Pokémon, and more than a hundred of its Murkrow cronies will assemble.

name: Glameow
entry_diamond: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness is very popular among some.
entry_black: It hides its spiteful tendency of hooking its claws into the nose of its Trainer if it isn’t fed.
entry_x: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness is very popular among some.

name: Purugly
entry_diamond: It is a brazen brute that barges its way into another Pokémon’s nest and claims it as its own.
entry_black: It binds its body with its tails to make itself look bigger. If it locks eyes, it will glare ceaselessly.
entry_x: It would claim another Pokémon’s nest as its own if it finds a nest sufficiently comfortable.

name: Chingling
entry_diamond: It emits cries by agitating an orb at the back of its throat. It moves with flouncing hops.
entry_black: There is an orb inside its mouth. When it hops, the orb bounces all over and makes a ringing sound.
entry_x: Each time it hops, it makes a ringing sound. It deafens foes by emitting high-frequency cries.

name: Stunky
entry_diamond: It protects itself by spraying a noxious fluid from its rear. The stench lingers for 24 hours.
entry_black: It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokémon away.
entry_x: It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokémon away.
entry_sword: From its rear, it sprays a foul-smelling liquid at opponents. It aims for their faces, and it can hit them from over 16 feet away.

name: Skuntank
entry_diamond: It sprays a vile-smelling fluid from the tip of its tail to attack. Its range is over 160 feet.
entry_black: It attacks by spraying a horribly smelly fluid from the tip of its tail. Attacks from above confound it.
entry_x: It sprays a vile-smelling fluid from the tip of its tail to attack. Its range is over 160 feet.
entry_sword: In its belly, it reserves stinky fluid that it shoots from its tail during battle. As this Pokémon’s diet varies, so does the stench of its fluid.

name: Bronzor
entry_diamond: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.
entry_black: There are researchers who believe this Pokémon reflected like a mirror in the distant past.
entry_x: Ancient people believed that the pattern on Bronzor’s back contained a mysterious power.
entry_sword: It appears in ancient ruins. The pattern on its body doesn’t come from any culture in the Galar region, so it remains shrouded in mystery.

name: Bronzong
entry_diamond: One caused a news sensation when it was dug up at a construction site after a 2,000-year sleep.
entry_black: It brought rains by opening portals to another world. It was revered as a bringer of plentiful harvests.
entry_x: In ages past, this Pokémon was revered as a bringer of rain. It was found buried in the ground.
entry_sword: Some believe it to be a deity that summons rain clouds. When angered, it lets out a warning cry that rings out like the tolling of a bell.

name: Bonsly
entry_diamond: It looks as if it is always crying. It is actually adjusting its body’s fluid levels by eliminating excess.
entry_black: It prefers an arid atmosphere. It leaks water that looks like tears when adjusting its moisture level.
entry_x: It prefers arid environments. It leaks water from its eyes to adjust its body’s fluid levels.
entry_sun: It does not deal well with water, so it lives in dry locales. Since its surroundings tend to lack greenery, it stands out noticeably.
entry_sword: It expels both sweat and tears from its eyes. The sweat is a little salty, while the tears have a slight bitterness.

name: Mime Jr
entry_diamond: It habitually mimics foes. Once mimicked, the foe cannot take its eyes off this Pokémon.
entry_black: It mimics the expressions and motions of those it sees to understand the feelings of others.
entry_x: In an attempt to confuse its enemy, it mimics the enemy’s movements. Then it wastes no time in making itself scarce!
entry_sword: It mimics everyone it sees, but it puts extra effort into copying the graceful dance steps of Mr. Rime as practice.

name: Happiny
abilities: Natural Cure, Serene Grace, Friend Guard
entry_diamond: It loves round white things. It carries an egg-shaped rock in imitation of CHANSEY.
entry_black: It likes to carry around a small rock. It may wander around others’ feet and cause them to stumble.
entry_x: It carries a round, egg-shaped rock in its belly pouch and gives the rock to its friends.
entry_sun: It carries a round white rock in its belly pouch. If it gets along well with someone, it will sometimes give that person the rock.
entry_sword: Mimicking Chansey, Happiny will place an egg- shaped stone in its belly pouch. Happiny will treasure this stone.

name: Chatot
abilities: Keen Eye, Tangled Feet, Big Pecks
entry_diamond: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.
entry_black: Its tongue is just like a human’s. As a result, it can cleverly mimic human speech.
entry_x: It mimics the cries of other Pokémon to trick them into thinking it’s one of them. This way they won’t attack it.

name: Spiritomb
entry_diamond: A Pokémon that was formed by 108 spirits. It is bound to a fissure in an odd keystone.
entry_black: Its constant mischief and misdeeds resulted in it being bound to an Odd Keystone by a mysterious spell.
entry_x: A Pokémon that was formed by 108 spirits. It is bound to a fissure in an odd keystone.
entry_sword: Exactly 108 spirits gathered to become this Pokémon. Apparently there are some ill-natured spirits in the mix.

name: Gible
entry_diamond: It nests in small, horizontal holes in cave walls. It pounces to catch prey that stray too close.
entry_black: It attacks using its huge mouth. While its attacks are powerful, it hurts itself out of clumsiness, too.
entry_x: It nests in horizontal holes warmed by geothermal heat. Foes who get too close can expect to be pounced on and bitten.
entry_sun: It lives in caves warmed by geothermal heat. Even so, when the weather gets cold, it will huddle close with others of its kind.
entry_sword: Gible prefers to stay in narrow holes in the sides of caves heated by geothermal energy. This way, Gible can stay warm even during a blizzard.

name: Gabite
entry_diamond: There is a long-held belief that medicine made from its scales will heal even incurable illnesses.
entry_black: It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot in its nest.
entry_x: It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot in its nest.
entry_sun: In rare cases, it molts and sheds its scales. Medicine containing its scales as an ingredient will make a weary body feel invigorated.
entry_sword: This Pokémon emits ultrasonic waves from a protrusion on either side of its head to probe pitch-dark caves.

name: Garchomp
entry_diamond: When it folds up its body and extends its wings, it looks like a jet plane. It flies at sonic speed.
entry_black: It is said that when one runs at high speed, its wings create blades of wind that can fell nearby trees.
entry_x: When it folds up its body and extends its wings, it looks like a jet plane. It flies at sonic speed.
entry_sun: It can fly at speeds rivaling jet planes. It dives into flocks of bird Pokémon and gulps the entire flock down whole.
entry_sword: Garchomp makes its home in volcanic mountains. It flies through the sky as fast as a jet airplane, hunting down as much prey as it can.

name: Munchlax
entry_diamond: It wolfs down its weight in food once a day, swallowing food whole with almost no chewing.
entry_black: In its desperation to gulp down food, it forgets about the food it has hidden under its fur.
entry_x: It hides food under its long body hair. However, it forgets it has hidden the food.
entry_sun: It needs to consume its own weight in food every day. As far as flavor is concerned, it’s indifferent.
entry_sword: Stuffing itself with vast amounts of food is its only concern. Whether the food is rotten or fresh, yummy or tasteless—it does not care.

name: Riolu
entry_diamond: The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to alert others if it is afraid or sad.
entry_black: It has the peculiar power of being able to see emotions such as joy and rage in the form of waves.
entry_x: It uses the shapes of auras, which change according to emotion, to communicate with others.
entry_sun: It can discern the physical and emotional states of people, Pokémon, and other natural things from the shape of their aura waves.
entry_sword: It’s exceedingly energetic, with enough stamina to keep running all through the night. Taking it for walks can be a challenging experience.

name: Lucario
entry_diamond: It has the ability to sense the auras of all things. It understands human speech.
entry_black: A well-trained one can sense auras to identify and take in the feelings of creatures over half a mile away.
entry_x: By catching the aura emanating from others, it can read their thoughts and movements.
entry_sun: Not only does it perceive auras, but it has also gained the power to control them. It employs them in battle.
entry_sword: It controls waves known as auras, which are powerful enough to pulverize huge rocks. It uses these waves to take down its prey.

name: Hippopotas
entry_diamond: It lives in arid places. Instead of perspiration, it expels grainy sand from its body.
entry_black: It shuts its nostrils tight then travels through sand as if walking. They form colonies of around ten.
entry_x: It lives in arid places. Instead of perspiration, it expels grainy sand from its body.
entry_sword: It moves through the sands with its mouth open, swallowing sand along with its prey. It gets rid of the sand by spouting it from its nose.

name: Hippowdon
entry_diamond: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.
entry_black: It is surprisingly quick to anger. It holds its mouth agape as a display of its strength.
entry_x: It brandishes its gaping mouth in a display of fearsome strength. It raises vast quantities of sand while attacking.
entry_sword: Stones can get stuck in the ports on their bodies. Dwebble help dislodge such stones, so Hippowdon look after these Pokémon.

name: Skorupi
entry_diamond: It grips prey with its tail claws and injects poison. It tenaciously hangs on until the poison takes.
entry_black: As soon as the tail claws close, its needle tips secrete poison. It can survive a year without food.
entry_x: It grips prey with its tail claws and injects poison. It tenaciously hangs on until the poison takes.
entry_sword: After burrowing into the sand, it waits patiently for prey to come near. This Pokémon and Sizzlipede share common descent.

name: Drapion
entry_diamond: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.
entry_black: Possessing a sturdy build, it takes pride in its strength, taking down foes without using toxins.
entry_x: It takes pride in its strength. Even though it can tear foes apart, it finishes them off with powerful poison.
entry_sword: Its poison is potent, but it rarely sees use. This Pokémon prefers to use physical force instead, going on rampages with its car-crushing strength.

name: Croagunk
entry_diamond: Its cheeks hold poison sacs. It tries to catch foes off guard to jab them with toxic fingers.
entry_black: It rarely fights fairly, but that is strictly to ensure survival. It is popular as a mascot.
entry_x: Its cheeks hold poison sacs. It tries to catch foes off guard to jab them with toxic fingers.
entry_sword: It makes frightening noises with its poison-filled cheek sacs. When opponents flinch, Croagunk hits them with a poison jab.

name: Toxicroak
entry_diamond: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.
entry_black: It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks, the stored poison is churned for greater potency.
entry_x: It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks, the stored poison is churned for greater potency.
entry_sword: It bounces toward opponents and gouges them with poisonous claws. No more than a scratch is needed to knock out its adversaries.

name: Carnivine
entry_diamond: It attracts prey with its sweet- smelling saliva, then chomps down. It takes a whole day to eat prey.
entry_black: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet- smelling drool and gulps them down.
entry_x: It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling saliva, then chomps down. It takes a whole day to eat prey.

name: Finneon
abilities: Swift Swim, Storm Drain, Water Veil
entry_diamond: After long exposure to sunlight, the patterns on its tail fins shine vividly when darkness arrives.
entry_black: The line running down its side can store sunlight. It shines vividly at night.
entry_x: The line running down its side can store sunlight. It shines vividly at night.
entry_sun: It absorbs sunlight with the pink areas of its skin, which then shine. This appears to be a form of camouflage.

name: Lumineon
abilities: Swift Swim, Storm Drain, Water Veil
entry_diamond: It lives on the deep-sea floor. It attracts prey by flashing the patterns on its four tail fins.
entry_black: It crawls along the seafloor using its long front fins like legs. It competes for food with Lanturn.
entry_x: It lives on the deep-sea floor. It attracts prey by flashing the patterns on its four tail fins.
entry_sun: With its shining light, it lures its prey close. However, the light also happens to attract ferocious fish Pokémon—its natural predators.

name: Mantyke
abilities: Swift Swim, Water Absorb, Water Veil
entry_diamond: A friendly Pokémon that captures the subtle flows of seawater using its two antennae.
entry_black: People organize tours to see this Pokémon frolic and skim the tops of waves with Remoraid.
entry_x: The pattern on its back varies by region. It often swims in a school of Remoraid.
entry_sword: Mantyke living in Galar seem to be somewhat sluggish. The colder waters of the seas in this region may be the cause.

name: Snover
entry_diamond: It lives on snowy mountains. Having had little contact with humans, it is boldly inquisitive.
entry_black: Seemingly curious about people, they gather around footsteps they find on snowy mountains.
entry_x: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain’s lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.
entry_sword: It lives on snowy mountains. It sinks its legs into the snow to absorb water and keep its own temperature down.

name: Abomasnow
entry_diamond: It whips up blizzards in mountains that are always buried in snow. It is the abominable snowman.
entry_black: They appear when the snow flowers bloom. When the petals fall, they retreat to places unknown again.
entry_x: It blankets wide areas in snow by whipping up blizzards. It is also known as “The Ice Monster.”
entry_sword: If it sees any packs of Darumaka going after Snover, it chases them off, swinging its sizable arms like hammers.

name: Weavile
entry_diamond: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.
entry_black: Evolution made it even more devious. It communicates by clawing signs in boulders.
entry_x: It lives in snowy regions. It carves patterns in trees with its claws as a signal to others.
entry_sun: They travel in groups of four or five, leaving signs for one another on trees and rocks. They bring down their prey with coordinated attacks.
entry_sword: They attack their quarry in packs. Prey as large as Mamoswine easily fall to the teamwork of a group of Weavile.

name: Magnezone
entry_diamond: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.
entry_black: A group tried to use scientific means to make Magnezone evolve, but their efforts ended in failure.
entry_x: Sometimes the magnetism emitted by Magnezone is too strong, making them attract each other so they cannot move.
entry_sun: Three units generate magnetism. There have been many mistaken reports of UFO sightings when Magnezone flies through the night sky.
entry_sword: Some say that Magnezone receives signals from space via the antenna on its head and that it’s being controlled by some mysterious being.

name: Lickilicky
entry_diamond: It wraps things with its extensible tongue. Getting too close to it will leave you soaked with drool.
entry_black: The long tongue is always soggy with slobber. The saliva contains a solvent that causes numbness.
entry_x: It wraps things with its extensible tongue. Getting too close to it will leave you soaked with drool.
entry_sword: Lickilicky’s strange tongue can stretch to many times the length of its body. No one has figured out how Lickilicky’s tongue can stretch so far.

name: Rhyperior
entry_diamond: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. GEODUDE are shot at rare times.
entry_black: It can launch a rock held in its hand like a missile by tightening then expanding muscles instantly.
entry_x: From holes in its palms, it fires out Geodude. Its carapace can withstand volcanic eruptions.
entry_sword: It can load up to three projectiles per arm into the holes in its hands. What launches out of those holes could be either rocks or Roggenrola.

name: Tangrowth
entry_diamond: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.
entry_black: Its arms are made of plants that bind themselves to things. They grow back right away if cut.
entry_x: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.
entry_sword: Tangrowth has two arms that it can extend as it pleases. Recent research has shown that these arms are, in fact, bundles of vines.

name: Electivire
entry_diamond: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of power.
entry_black: Heedless of enemy attacks, it closes in, shoves its tails onto the foe, then looses high voltage.
entry_x: As its electric charge amplifies, blue sparks begin to crackle between its horns.
entry_sun: It pushes the tips of its tails against its foes and then lets loose a high-voltage current. Its foes are burned to a crisp in an instant.
entry_sword: The amount of electrical energy this Pokémon produces is proportional to the rate of its pulse. The voltage jumps while Electivire is battling.

name: Magmortar
entry_diamond: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees F from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.
entry_black: When launching 3,600 degrees F fireballs, its body takes on a whitish hue from the intense heat.
entry_x: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.
entry_sun: They dwell in volcanic craters. According to what is known, a single pair of male and female Magmortar lives in one volcano.
entry_sword: When Magmortar inhales deeply, the fire burning in its belly intensifies, rising in temperature to over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Togekiss
entry_diamond: It will never appear where there is strife. Its sightings have become rare recently.
entry_black: It shares many blessings with people who respect one another’s rights and avoid needless strife.
entry_x: As everyone knows, it visits peaceful regions, bringing them gifts of kindness and sweet blessings.
entry_sword: These Pokémon are never seen anywhere near conflict or turmoil. In recent times, they’ve hardly been seen at all.

name: Yanmega
entry_diamond: By churning its wings, it creates shock waves that inflict critical internal injuries to foes.
entry_black: Its jaw power is incredible. It is adept at biting apart foes while flying by at high speed.
entry_x: It prefers to battle by biting apart foes’ heads instantly while flying by at high speed.

name: Leafeon
entry_diamond: Just like a plant, it uses photosynthesis. As a result, it is always enveloped in clear air.
entry_black: It basically does not fight. With cells similar to those of plants, it can perform photosynthesis.
entry_x: When you see Leafeon asleep in a patch of sunshine, you’ll know it is using photosynthesis to produce clean air.
entry_sun: Its cellular composition is closer to that of a plant than an animal. It uses photosynthesis to produce its energy supply without eating food.
entry_sword: Galarians favor the distinctive aroma that drifts from this Pokémon’s leaves. There’s a popular perfume made using that scent.

name: Glaceon
entry_diamond: As a protective technique, it can completely freeze its fur to make its hairs stand like needles.
entry_black: By controlling its body heat, it can freeze the atmosphere around it to make a diamond-dust flurry.
entry_x: By controlling its body heat, it can freeze the atmosphere around it to make a diamond-dust flurry.
entry_sun: It can control its body temperature at will. This enables it to freeze the moisture in the atmosphere, creating flurries of diamond dust.
entry_sword: Any who become captivated by the beauty of the snowfall that Glaceon creates will be frozen before they know it.

name: Gliscor
abilities: Hyper Cutter, Sand Veil, Poison Heal
entry_diamond: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!
entry_black: If it succeeds in catching even a faint breeze properly, it can circle the globe without flapping once.
entry_x: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!

name: Mamoswine
entry_diamond: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The population thinned when it turned warm after the ice age.
entry_black: A frozen one was dug up from soil dating back 10,000 years. It woke up to much amazement.
entry_x: A frozen Mamoswine was dug from ice dating back 10,000 years. This Pokémon has been around a long, long, long time.
entry_sword: This Pokémon can be spotted in wall paintings from as far back as 10,000 years ago. For a while, it was thought to have gone extinct.

name: Porygon Z
entry_diamond: Additional software was installed to make it a better Pokémon. It began acting oddly, however.
entry_black: Its programming was modified to enable work in alien dimensions. It did not work as planned.
entry_x: Additional software was installed to make it a better Pokémon. It began acting oddly, however.
entry_sun: In order to create a more advanced Pokémon, an additional program was installed, but apparently it contained a defect that makes it move oddly.
entry_sword: Porygon-Z had a program installed to allow it to move between dimensions, but the program also caused instability in Porygon-Z’s behavior.

name: Gallade
entry_diamond: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using extending swords on its elbows.
entry_black: When trying to protect someone, it extends its elbows as if they were swords and fights savagely.
entry_x: Because it can sense what its foe is thinking, its attacks burst out first, fast, and fierce.
entry_sword: True to its honorable-warrior image, it uses the blades on its elbows only in defense of something or someone.

name: Probopass
entry_diamond: It exudes strong magnetism from all over. It controls three small units called Mini-Noses.
entry_black: It freely controls three small units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force.
entry_x: It exudes strong magnetism from all over. It controls three small units called Mini-Noses.
entry_sun: It radiates such a powerful magnetic field that nearby electrical appliances become unusable.

name: Dusknoir
entry_diamond: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.
entry_black: It is said to take lost spirits into its pliant body and guide them home.
entry_x: It is said to take lost spirits into its pliant body and guide them home.
entry_sword: At the bidding of transmissions from the spirit world, it steals people and Pokémon away. No one knows whether it has a will of its own.

name: Froslass
entry_diamond: It freezes foes with an icy breath nearly -60 degrees F. What seems to be its body is actually hollow.
entry_black: It freezes prey by blowing its -58 degrees F breath. It is said to then secretly display its prey.
entry_x: It freezes foes with an icy breath nearly -60 degrees Fahrenheit. What seems to be its body is actually hollow.
entry_sun: When it finds humans or Pokémon it likes, it freezes them and takes them to its chilly den, where they become decorations.
entry_sword: After a woman met her end on a snowy mountain, her regrets lingered on. From them, this Pokémon was born. Its favorite food is frozen souls.

name: Rotom
entry_diamond: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.
entry_black: Its electric-like body can enter some kinds of machines and take control in order to make mischief.
entry_x: Research continues on this Pokémon, which could be the power source of a unique motor.
entry_sword: One boy’s invention led to the development of many different machines that take advantage of Rotom’s unique capabilities.

name: Uxie
entry_diamond: Known as “The Being of Knowledge.” It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.
entry_black: When Uxie flew, people gained the ability to solve problems. It was the birth of knowledge.
entry_x: Known as “The Being of Knowledge.” It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.

name: Mesprit
entry_diamond: Known as “The Being of Emotion.” It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.
entry_black: When Mesprit flew, people learned the joy and sadness of living. It was the birth of emotions.
entry_x: Known as “The Being of Emotion.” It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.

name: Azelf
entry_diamond: Known as “The Being of Willpower.” It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.
entry_black: When Azelf flew, people gained the determination to do things. It was the birth of willpower.
entry_x: Known as “The Being of Willpower.” It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.

name: Dialga
entry_diamond: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.
entry_black: A legendary Pokémon of Sinnoh. It is said that time flows when Dialga’s heart beats.
entry_x: A Pokémon spoken of in legend. It is said that time began moving when Dialga was born.

name: Palkia
entry_diamond: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.
entry_black: A legendary Pokémon of Sinnoh. It is said that space becomes more stable with Palkia’s every breath.
entry_x: It is said to live in a gap in the spatial dimension parallel to ours. It appears in mythology.

name: Heatran
entry_diamond: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.
entry_black: Its body is made of rugged steel. However, it is partially melted in spots because of its own heat.
entry_x: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.

name: Regigigas
entry_diamond: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.
entry_black: It is said to have made Pokémon that look like itself from a special ice mountain, rocks, and magma.
entry_x: It is said to have made Pokémon that look like itself from a special ice mountain, rocks, and magma.
entry_sword: All over the world, there are legends that tell of Regigigas creating other Pokémon in its own image.

name: Giratina Altered
entry_diamond: A Pokémon that is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours. It appears in an ancient cemetery.
entry_black: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.
entry_x: This Pokémon is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours, where common knowledge is distorted and strange.

name: Cresselia
entry_diamond: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.
entry_black: On nights around the quarter moon, the aurora from its tail extends and undulates beautifully.
entry_x: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

name: Phione
entry_diamond: A Pokémon that lives in warm seas. It inflates the flotation sac on its head to drift and search for food.
entry_black: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.
entry_x: When the water warms, they inflate the flotation sac on their heads and drift languidly on the sea in packs.

name: Manaphy
entry_diamond: Born on a cold seafloor, it will swim great distances to return to its birthplace.
entry_black: It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond with any kind of Pokémon.
entry_x: It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond with any kind of Pokémon.

name: Darkrai
entry_diamond: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.
entry_black: To protect itself, it afflicts those around it with nightmares. However, it means no harm.
entry_x: It chases people and Pokémon from its territory by causing them to experience deep, nightmarish slumbers.

name: Shaymin Land
entry_diamond: It lives in flower patches and avoids detection by curling up to look like a flowering plant.
entry_black: The flowers all over its body burst into bloom if it is lovingly hugged and senses gratitude.
entry_x: It can dissolve toxins in the air to instantly transform ruined land into a lush field of flowers.

name: Arceus
entry_diamond: It is described in mythology as the Pokémon that shaped the universe with its 1,000 arms.
entry_black: It is said to have emerged from an egg in a place where there was nothing, then shaped the world.
entry_x: According to the legends of Sinnoh, this Pokémon emerged from an egg and shaped all there is in this world.

name: Victini
entry_black: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.
entry_x: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.

name: Snivy
entry_black: It is very intelligent and calm. Being exposed to lots of sunlight makes its movements swifter.
entry_x: Being exposed to sunlight makes its movements swifter. It uses vines more adeptly than its hands.

name: Servine
entry_black: It moves along the ground as if sliding. Its swift movements befuddle its foes, and it then attacks with a vine whip.
entry_x: It moves along the ground as if sliding. Its swift movements befuddle its foes, and it then attacks with a vine whip.

name: Serperior
entry_black: It can stop its opponents’ movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.
entry_x: It only gives its all against strong opponents who are not fazed by the glare from Serperior’s noble eyes.

name: Tepig
entry_black: It can deftly dodge its foe’s attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.
entry_x: It can deftly dodge its foe’s attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.

name: Pignite
entry_black: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.
entry_x: The more it eats, the more fuel it has to make the fire in its stomach stronger. This fills it with even more power.

name: Emboar
entry_black: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.
entry_x: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.

name: Oshawott
entry_black: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.
entry_x: The scalchop on its stomach isn’t just used for battle--it can be used to break open hard berries as well.

name: Dewott
entry_black: Strict training is how it learns its flowing double-scalchop technique.
entry_x: Strict training is how it learns its flowing double-scalchop technique.

name: Samurott
entry_black: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.
entry_x: In the time it takes a foe to blink, it can draw and sheathe the seamitars attached to its front legs.

name: Patrat
entry_black: Using food stored in cheek pouches, they can keep watch for days. They use their tails to communicate with others.
entry_x: Using food stored in cheek pouches, they can keep watch for days. They use their tails to communicate with others.

name: Watchog
entry_black: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.
entry_x: Using luminescent matter, it makes its eyes and body glow and stuns attacking opponents.

name: Lillipup
entry_black: It faces strong opponents with great courage. But, when at a disadvantage in a fight, this intelligent Pokémon flees.
entry_x: The long hair around its face provides an amazing radar that lets it sense subtle changes in its surroundings.
entry_sun: Because it doesn’t yelp, it’s extremely popular with Trainers who live in apartment buildings.
entry_sword: This Pokémon is courageous but also cautious. It uses the soft fur covering its face to collect information about its surroundings.

name: Herdier
entry_black: It has black, cape-like fur that is very hard and decreases the amount of damage it receives.
entry_x: This very loyal Pokémon helps Trainers, and it also takes care of other Pokémon.
entry_sun: Its dense black fur grows continuously. The high cost of keeping its hard fur properly groomed makes this a troublesome Pokémon to train.
entry_sword: Herdier is a very smart and friendly Pokémon. So much so that there’s a theory that Herdier was the first Pokémon to partner with people.

name: Stoutland
entry_black: It rescues people stranded by blizzards in the mountains. Its shaggy fur shields it from the cold.
entry_x: It rescues people stranded by blizzards in the mountains. Its shaggy fur shields it from the cold.
entry_sun: Intelligent, good-natured, and valiant, it’s a trustworthy partner on rescue teams.
entry_sword: These Pokémon seem to enjoy living with humans. Even a Stoutland caught in the wild will warm up to people in about three days.

name: Purrloin
entry_black: They steal from people for fun, but their victims can’t help but forgive them. Their deceptively cute act is perfect.
entry_x: Its cute act is a ruse. When victims let down their guard, they find their items taken. It attacks with sharp claws.
entry_sword: It steals things from people just to amuse itself with their frustration. A rivalry exists between this Pokémon and Nickit.

name: Liepard
entry_black: These Pokémon vanish and appear unexpectedly. Many Trainers are drawn to their beautiful form and fur.
entry_x: Their beautiful form comes from the muscles they have developed. They run silently in the night.
entry_sword: Don’t be fooled by its gorgeous fur and elegant figure. This is a moody and vicious Pokémon.

name: Pansage
entry_black: This Pokémon dwells deep in the forest. Eating a leaf from its head whisks weariness away as if by magic.
entry_x: It shares the leaf on its head with weary-looking Pokémon. These leaves are known to relieve stress.

name: Simisage
entry_black: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.
entry_x: It attacks enemies with strikes of its thorn-covered tail. This Pokémon is wild tempered.

name: Pansear
entry_black: When it is angered, the temperature of its head tuft reaches 600° F. It uses its tuft to roast berries.
entry_x: Very intelligent, it roasts berries before eating them. It likes to help people.

name: Simisear
entry_black: It loves sweets because they become energy for the fire burning inside its body.
entry_x: A flame burns inside its body. It scatters embers from its head and tail to sear its opponents.

name: Panpour
entry_black: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.
entry_x: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. It waters plants with it using its tail.

name: Simipour
entry_black: The tuft on its head holds water. When the level runs low, it replenishes the tuft by siphoning up water with its tail.
entry_x: The high-pressure water expelled from its tail is so powerful, it can destroy a concrete wall.

name: Munna
entry_black: Munna always float in the air. People whose dreams are eaten by them forget what the dreams had been about.
entry_x: This Pokémon appears before people and Pokémon who are having nightmares and eats those dreams.
entry_sword: Late at night, it appears beside people’s pillows. As it feeds on dreams, the patterns on its body give off a faint glow.

name: Musharna
entry_black: The mist emanating from their foreheads is packed with the dreams of people and Pokémon.
entry_x: The mist emanating from their foreheads is packed with the dreams of people and Pokémon.
entry_sword: When dark mists emanate from its body, don’t get too near. If you do, your nightmares will become reality.

name: Pidove
entry_black: Each follows its Trainer’s orders as best it can, but they sometimes fail to understand complicated commands.
entry_x: This very forgetful Pokémon will wait for a new order from its Trainer even though it already has one.
entry_sword: Where people go, these Pokémon follow. If you’re scattering food for them, be careful— several hundred of them can gather at once.

name: Tranquill
entry_black: It can return to its Trainer’s location regardless of the distance separating them.
entry_x: Many people believe that, deep in the forest where Tranquill live, there is a peaceful place where there is no war.
entry_sword: It can fly moderately quickly. No matter how far it travels, it can always find its way back to its master and its nest.

name: Unfezant
entry_black: Males swing their head plumage to threaten opponents. The females’ flying abilities surpass those of the males.
entry_x: Males swing their head plumage to threaten opponents. The females’ flying abilities surpass those of the males.
entry_sword: Unfezant are exceptional fliers. The females are known for their stamina, while the males outclass them in terms of speed.

name: Blitzle
abilities: Lightning Rod, Motor Drive, Sap Sipper
entry_black: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use their flashing manes to communicate with one another.
entry_x: When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear. It can catch lightning with its mane and store the electricity.

name: Zebstrika
abilities: Lightning Rod, Motor Drive, Sap Sipper
entry_black: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.
entry_x: When this ill-tempered Pokémon runs wild, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.

name: Roggenrola
entry_black: Its ear is hexagonal in shape. Compressed underground, its body is as hard as steel.
entry_x: Its ear is hexagonal in shape. Compressed underground, its body is as hard as steel.
entry_sun: Born deep within the ground, it compares itself with similar species, such as Geodude and Carbink, to settle which has the hardest body.
entry_sword: It’s as hard as steel, but apparently a long soak in water will cause it to soften a bit.

name: Boldore
entry_black: When it overflows with power, the orange crystal on its body glows. It looks for underground water in caves.
entry_x: Because its energy was too great to be contained, the energy leaked and formed orange crystals.
entry_sun: Its orange crystal is a mass of energy. Just one crystal fragment would provide enough fuel for a hundred dump trucks.
entry_sword: If you see its orange crystals start to glow, be wary. It’s about to fire off bursts of energy.

name: Gigalith
entry_black: Compressing the energy from its internal core lets it fire off an attack capable of blowing away a mountain.
entry_x: The solar rays it absorbs are processed in its energy core and fired as a ball of light.
entry_sun: The blasts of energy it makes from sunbeams have terrifying power. However, it’s not able to fire its blasts at night or on rainy days.
entry_sword: This hardy Pokémon can often be found on construction sites and in mines, working alongside people and Copperajah.

name: Woobat
entry_black: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.
entry_x: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.
entry_sword: While inside a cave, if you look up and see lots of heart-shaped marks lining the walls, it’s evidence that Woobat live there.

name: Swoobat
entry_black: It emits sound waves of various frequencies from its nose, including some powerful enough to destroy rocks.
entry_x: It shakes its tail vigorously when it emits ultrasonic waves strong enough to reduce concrete to rubble.
entry_sword: Emitting powerful sound waves tires it out. Afterward, it won’t be able to fly for a little while.

name: Drilbur
abilities: Sand Rush, Sand Force, Mold Breaker
entry_black: It can dig through the ground at a speed of 30 mph. It could give a car running aboveground a good race.
entry_x: It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting both claws together and rotating at high speed.
entry_sword: It brings its claws together and whirls around at high speed before rushing toward its prey.

name: Excadrill
abilities: Sand Rush, Sand Force, Mold Breaker
entry_black: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.
entry_x: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.
entry_sword: It’s not uncommon for tunnels that appear to have formed naturally to actually be a result of Excadrill’s rampant digging.

name: Audino
entry_black: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.
entry_x: Using the feelers on its ears, it can tell how someone is feeling or when an egg might hatch.
entry_sword: Audino’s sense of hearing is superb. Not even a pebble rolling along over a mile away will escape Audino’s ears.

name: Timburr
entry_black: It fights by swinging a piece of lumber around. It is close to evolving when it can handle the lumber without difficulty.
entry_x: These Pokémon appear at building sites and help out with construction. They always carry squared logs.
entry_sword: It loves helping out with construction projects. It loves it so much that if rain causes work to halt, it swings its log around and throws a tantrum.

name: Gurdurr
entry_black: This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.
entry_x: With strengthened bodies, they skillfully wield steel beams to take down buildings.
entry_sword: It shows off its muscles to Machoke and other Gurdurr. If it fails to measure up to the other Pokémon, it lies low for a little while.

name: Conkeldurr
entry_black: It is thought that Conkeldurr taught humans how to make concrete more than 2,000 years ago.
entry_x: It is thought that Conkeldurr taught humans how to make concrete more than 2,000 years ago.
entry_sword: Concrete mixed by Conkeldurr is much more durable than normal concrete, even when the compositions of the two materials are the same.

name: Tympole
entry_black: They warn others of danger by vibrating their cheeks to create a high-pitched sound.
entry_x: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans and warns others of danger.
entry_sword: Graceful ripples running across the water’s surface are a sure sign that Tympole are singing in high-pitched voices below.

name: Palpitoad
entry_black: When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, they can make waves in water or earthquake-like vibrations on land.
entry_x: When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, they can make waves in water or earthquake-like vibrations on land.
entry_sword: It weakens its prey with sound waves intense enough to cause headaches, then entangles them with its sticky tongue.

name: Seismitoad
abilities: Swift Swim, Poison Touch, Water Absorb
entry_black: They shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps. They use vibration to hurt their opponents.
entry_x: It increases the power of its punches by vibrating the bumps on its fists. It can turn a boulder to rubble with one punch.
entry_sword: The vibrating of the bumps all over its body causes earthquake-like tremors. Seismitoad and Croagunk are similar species.

name: Throh
entry_black: When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave their own belts.
entry_x: When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave their own belts.
entry_sword: It performs throwing moves with first-rate skill. Over the course of many battles, Throh’s belt grows darker as it absorbs its wearer’s sweat.

name: Sawk
entry_black: The sound of Sawk punching boulders and trees can be heard all the way from the mountains where they train.
entry_x: Desiring the strongest karate chop, they seclude themselves in mountains and train without sleeping.
entry_sword: If you see a Sawk training in the mountains in its single-minded pursuit of strength, it’s best to quietly pass by.

name: Sewaddle
entry_black: Leavanny dress it in clothes they made for it when it hatched. It hides its head in its hood while it is sleeping.
entry_x: This Pokémon makes clothes for itself. It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth.

name: Swadloon
entry_black: Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.
entry_x: Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.

name: Leavanny
entry_black: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves, using the cutters on its arms and sticky silk.
entry_x: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves by using the sticky silk secreted from its mouth.

name: Venipede
entry_black: Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze large bird Pokémon that try to prey on it.
entry_x: It discovers what is going on around it by using the feelers on its head and tail. It is brutally aggressive.
entry_sword: Venipede and Sizzlipede are similar species, but when the two meet, a huge fight ensues.

name: Whirlipede
entry_black: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.
entry_x: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.
entry_sword: This Pokémon spins itself rapidly and charges into its opponents. Its top speed is just over 60 mph.

name: Scolipede
entry_black: With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.
entry_x: It clasps its prey with the claws on its neck until it stops moving. Then it finishes it off with deadly poison.
entry_sword: Scolipede latches on to its prey with the claws on its neck before slamming them into the ground and jabbing them with its claws’ toxic spikes.

name: Cottonee
entry_black: When attacked, it escapes by shooting cotton from its body. The cotton serves as a decoy to distract the attacker.
entry_x: When attacked, it escapes by shooting cotton from its body. The cotton serves as a decoy to distract the attacker.
entry_sun: When it finds others of its kind, they all stick together. When enough of them have collected, the mass resembles a cumulonimbus cloud.
entry_sword: It shoots cotton from its body to protect itself. If it gets caught up in hurricane-strength winds, it can get sent to the other side of the Earth.

name: Whimsicott
entry_black: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. It leaves balls of white fluff behind.
entry_x: They appear along with whirlwinds. They pull pranks, such as moving furniture and leaving balls of cotton in homes.
entry_sun: It rides on the wind and slips into people’s homes. After it has turned a room into a cotton- filled mess, it giggles to itself and takes off.
entry_sword: It scatters cotton all over the place as a prank. If it gets wet, it’ll become too heavy to move and have no choice but to answer for its mischief.

name: Petilil
entry_black: The leaves on its head are very bitter. Eating one of these leaves is known to refresh a tired body.
entry_x: The leaves on its head are very bitter. Eating one of these leaves is known to refresh a tired body.
entry_sun: Although the leaves on its head are bitter enough to cause dizziness, they provide relief from weariness—even more so when boiled.
entry_sword: Petilil appears around sources of clean water. Boiling leaves from this Pokémon’s head results in a liquid that’s sometimes used as a bug repellent.

name: Lilligant
entry_black: Even veteran Trainers face a challenge in getting its beautiful flower to bloom. This Pokémon is popular with celebrities.
entry_x: The fragrance of the garland on its head has a relaxing effect. It withers if a Trainer does not take good care of it.
entry_sun: No matter how much time and money is spent raising it, its flowers are the most beautiful when they bloom in the wild.
entry_sword: It’s believed that even first-rate gardeners have a hard time getting the flower on a Lilligant’s head to bloom.

name: Basculin Red Striped
entry_black: Red and blue Basculin get along so poorly, they’ll start fighting instantly. These Pokémon are very hostile.
entry_x: Red- and blue-striped Basculin are very violent and always fighting. They are also remarkably tasty.
entry_sword: Anglers love the fight this Pokémon puts up on the hook. And there are always more to catch— many people release them into lakes illicitly.

name: Sandile
entry_black: They live buried in the sands of the desert. The sun-warmed sands prevent their body temperature from dropping.
entry_x: It moves along below the sand’s surface, except for its nose and eyes. A dark membrane shields its eyes from the sun.
entry_sun: It submerges itself in sand and moves as if swimming. This wise behavior keeps its enemies from finding it and maintains its temperature.
entry_sword: The desert gets cold at night, so when the sun sets, this Pokémon burrows deep into the sand and sleeps until sunrise.

name: Krokorok
entry_black: They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.
entry_x: They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.
entry_sun: They move in groups of a few individuals. A female is often the leader of the group, and the males will gather food.
entry_sword: Krokorok has specialized eyes that enable it to see in the dark. This ability lets Krokorok hunt in the dead of night without getting lost.

name: Krookodile
entry_black: They never allow prey to escape. Their jaws are so powerful, they can crush the body of an automobile.
entry_x: Very violent Pokémon, they try to clamp down on anything that moves in front of their eyes.
entry_sun: Its unique faculty of sight can detect small prey more than 30 miles away, even in the midst of a sandstorm.
entry_sword: This Pokémon is known as the Bully of the Sands. Krookodile’s mighty jaws can bite through heavy plates of iron with almost no effort at all.

name: Darumaka
entry_black: When its internal fire is burning, it cannot calm down and it runs around. When the fire diminishes, it falls asleep.
entry_x: Darumaka’s droppings are hot, so people used to put them in their clothes to keep themselves warm.
entry_sword: It derives its power from fire burning inside its body. If the fire dwindles, this Pokémon will immediately fall asleep.

name: Darmanitan Standard
entry_black: Its internal fire burns at 2,500° F, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.
entry_x: When one is injured in a fierce battle, it hardens into a stone-like form. Then it meditates and sharpens its mind.
entry_sword: The thick arms of this hot-blooded Pokémon can deliver punches capable of obliterating a dump truck.

name: Maractus
entry_black: It uses an up-tempo song and dance to drive away the bird Pokémon that prey on its flower seeds.
entry_x: It uses an up-tempo song and dance to drive away the bird Pokémon that prey on its flower seeds.
entry_sword: With noises that could be mistaken for the rattles of maracas, it creates an upbeat rhythm, startling bird Pokémon and making them fly off in a hurry.

name: Dwebble
entry_black: This Pokémon can easily melt holes in hard rocks with a liquid secreted from its mouth.
entry_x: It makes a hole in a suitable rock. If that rock breaks, the Pokémon remains agitated until it locates a replacement.
entry_sword: When it finds a stone appealing, it creates a hole inside it and uses it as its home. This Pokémon is the natural enemy of Roggenrola and Rolycoly.

name: Crustle
entry_black: Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.
entry_x: It possesses legs of enormous strength, enabling it to carry heavy slabs for many days, even when crossing arid land.
entry_sword: This highly territorial Pokémon prefers dry climates. It won’t come out of its boulder on rainy days.

name: Scraggy
entry_black: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.
entry_x: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.
entry_sword: If it locks eyes with you, watch out! Nothing and no one is safe from the reckless headbutts of this troublesome Pokémon.

name: Scrafty
entry_black: Groups of them beat up anything that enters their territory. Each can spit acidic liquid from its mouth.
entry_x: It pulls up its shed skin to protect itself while it kicks. The bigger the crest, the more respected it is.
entry_sword: As halfhearted as this Pokémon’s kicks may seem, they pack enough power to shatter Conkeldurr’s concrete pillars.

name: Sigilyph
abilities: Wonder Skin, Magic Guard, Tinted Lens
entry_black: They never vary the route they fly, because their memories of guarding an ancient city remain steadfast.
entry_x: The guardians of an ancient city, they use their psychic power to attack enemies that invade their territory.
entry_sword: Psychic power allows these Pokémon to fly. Some say they were the guardians of an ancient city. Others say they were the guardians’ emissaries.

name: Yamask
entry_black: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.
entry_x: These Pokémon arose from the spirits of people interred in graves. Each retains memories of its former life.
entry_sword: It wanders through ruins by night, carrying a mask that’s said to have been the face it had when it was still human.

name: Cofagrigus
entry_black: It has been said that they swallow those who get too close and turn them into mummies. They like to eat gold nuggets.
entry_x: It has been said that they swallow those who get too close and turn them into mummies. They like to eat gold nuggets.
entry_sword: This Pokémon has a body of sparkling gold. People say it no longer remembers that it was once human.

name: Tirtouga
entry_black: Restored from a fossil, this Pokémon can dive to depths beyond half a mile.
entry_x: About 100 million years ago, these Pokémon swam in oceans. It is thought they also went on land to attack prey.
entry_sun: Based on studies of its skeletal structure, it can apparently dive to ocean depths of over half a mile.
entry_sword: This Pokémon inhabited ancient seas. Although it can only crawl, it still comes up onto land in search of prey.

name: Carracosta
entry_black: They can live both in the ocean and on land. A slap from one of them is enough to open a hole in the bottom of a tanker.
entry_x: They can live both in the ocean and on land. A slap from one of them is enough to open a hole in the bottom of a tanker.
entry_sun: It constructed its sturdy shell by crunching and swallowing the hard shells or bones of its prey.
entry_sword: Carracosta completely devours its prey—bones, shells, and all. Because of this, Carracosta’s own shell grows thick and sturdy.

name: Archen
entry_black: Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon, they were unable to fly and moved about by hopping from one branch to another.
entry_x: Revived from a fossil, this Pokémon is thought to be the ancestor of all bird Pokémon.
entry_sun: It is the ancestor of all bird Pokémon. Archen itself could not actually fly but moved by hopping from treetop to treetop.
entry_sword: This Pokémon was successfully restored from a fossil. As research suggested, Archen is unable to fly. But it’s very good at jumping.

name: Archeops
entry_black: They are intelligent and will cooperate to catch prey. From the ground, they use a running start to take flight.
entry_x: They are intelligent and will cooperate to catch prey. From the ground, they use a running start to take flight.
entry_sun: Although apparently able to fly, they tended to run along the ground, averaging speeds of roughly 25 mph.
entry_sword: It needs a running start to take off. If Archeops wants to fly, it first needs to run nearly 25 mph, building speed over a course of about 2.5 miles.

name: Trubbish
entry_black: Inhaling the gas they belch will make you sleep for a week. They prefer unsanitary places.
entry_x: The combination of garbage bags and industrial waste caused the chemical reaction that created this Pokémon.
entry_sun: Unsanitary places are what they like best. They can be spotted in Alola, often with Grimer in hot pursuit.
entry_sword: Its favorite places are unsanitary ones. If you leave trash lying around, you could even find one of these Pokémon living in your room.

name: Garbodor
entry_black: It clenches opponents with its left arm and finishes them off with foul-smelling poison gas belched from its mouth.
entry_x: It clenches opponents with its left arm and finishes them off with foul-smelling poison gas belched from its mouth.
entry_sun: Beware the poisonous liquid it shoots from its right arm. If even a little of it gets on you, you’ll experience the effects of the unidentified toxin.
entry_sword: This Pokémon eats trash, which turns into poison inside its body. The main component of the poison depends on what sort of trash was eaten.

name: Zorua
entry_black: It changes into the forms of others to surprise them. Apparently, it often transforms into a silent child.
entry_x: It changes so it looks just like its foe, tricks it, and then uses that opportunity to flee.
entry_sword: Zorua is a timid Pokémon. This disposition seems to be what led to the development of Zorua’s ability to take on the forms of other creatures.

name: Zoroark
entry_black: Bonds between these Pokémon are very strong. It protects the safety of its pack by tricking its opponents.
entry_x: Each has the ability to fool a large group of people simultaneously. They protect their lair with illusory scenery.
entry_sword: This Pokémon cares deeply about others of its kind, and it will conjure terrifying illusions to keep its den and pack safe.

name: Minccino
entry_black: They greet one another by rubbing each other with their tails, which are always kept well groomed and clean.
entry_x: Minccino greet each other by grooming one another thoroughly with their tails.
entry_sword: The way it brushes away grime with its tail can be helpful when cleaning. But its focus on spotlessness can make cleaning more of a hassle.

name: Cinccino
entry_black: Their white fur is coated in a special oil that makes it easy for them to deflect attacks.
entry_x: Their white fur feels amazing to touch. Their fur repels dust and prevents static electricity from building up.
entry_sword: Its body secretes oil that this Pokémon spreads over its nest as a coating to protect it from dust. Cinccino won’t tolerate even a speck of the stuff.

name: Gothita
entry_black: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.
entry_x: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.
entry_sword: Though they’re still only babies, there’s psychic power stored in their ribbonlike feelers, and sometimes they use that power to fight.

name: Gothorita
entry_black: They use hypnosis to control people and Pokémon. Tales of Gothorita leading people astray are told in every corner.
entry_x: Starlight is the source of their power. At night, they mark star positions by using psychic power to float stones.
entry_sword: It’s said that when stars shine in the night sky, this Pokémon will spirit away sleeping children. Some call it the Witch of Punishment.

name: Gothitelle
entry_black: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.
entry_x: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.
entry_sword: It has tremendous psychic power, but it dislikes conflict. It’s also able to predict the future based on the movement of the stars.

name: Solosis
entry_black: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.
entry_x: Because their bodies are enveloped in a special liquid, they are fine in any environment, no matter how severe.
entry_sword: It communicates with others telepathically. Its body is encapsulated in liquid, but if it takes a heavy blow, the liquid will leak out.

name: Duosion
entry_black: Since they have two divided brains, at times they suddenly try to take two different actions at once.
entry_x: Since they have two divided brains, at times they suddenly try to take two different actions at once.
entry_sword: Its psychic power can supposedly cover a range of more than half a mile—but only if its two brains can agree with each other.

name: Reuniclus
entry_black: When Reuniclus shake hands, a network forms between their brains, increasing their psychic power.
entry_x: They use psychic power to control their arms, which are made of a special liquid. They can crush boulders psychically.
entry_sword: While it could use its psychic abilities in battle, this Pokémon prefers to swing its powerful arms around to beat opponents into submission.

name: Ducklett
entry_black: These bird Pokémon are excellent divers. They swim around in the water eating their favorite food--peat moss.
entry_x: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.

name: Swanna
entry_black: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.
entry_x: Despite their elegant appearance, they can flap their wings strongly and fly for thousands of miles.

name: Vanillite
abilities: Ice Body, Snow Cloak, Weak Armor
entry_black: The temperature of their breath is -58° F. They create snow crystals and make snow fall in the areas around them.
entry_x: The temperature of their breath is -58 degrees Fahrenheit. They create snow crystals and make snow fall in the areas around them.
entry_sun: Born of an icicle, this Pokémon uses its frosty breath to make ice crystals, causing snow to fall.
entry_sword: Unable to survive in hot areas, it makes itself comfortable by breathing out air cold enough to cause snow. It burrows into the snow to sleep.

name: Vanillish
abilities: Ice Body, Snow Cloak, Weak Armor
entry_black: Snowy mountains are this Pokémon’s habitat. During an ancient ice age, they moved to southern areas.
entry_x: They cool down the surrounding air and create ice particles, which they use to freeze their foes.
entry_sun: Hot days cause its body to melt. It can be restored by refreezing it, but the process leaves its body slightly warped.
entry_sword: By drinking pure water, it grows its icy body. This Pokémon can be hard to find on days with warm, sunny weather.

name: Vanilluxe
abilities: Ice Body, Snow Warning, Weak Armor
entry_black: Swallowing large amounts of water, they make snow clouds inside their bodies and attack their foes with violent blizzards.
entry_x: If both heads get angry simultaneously, this Pokémon expels a blizzard, burying everything in snow.
entry_sun: Each of its two heads has a brain, and when they are in agreement, it attacks its enemies by exhaling a violent blizzard.
entry_sword: When its anger reaches a breaking point, this Pokémon unleashes a fierce blizzard that freezes every creature around it, be they friend or foe.

name: Deerling
