entry_black: The color and scent of their fur changes to match the mountain grass. When they sense hostility, they hide in the grass.
entry_x: Their coloring changes according to the seasons and can be slightly affected by the temperature and humidity as well.

name: Sawsbuck
entry_black: They migrate according to the seasons. People can tell the season by looking at Sawsbuck’s horns.
entry_x: They migrate according to the seasons. People can tell the season by looking at Sawsbuck’s horns.

name: Emolga
entry_black: The energy made in its cheeks’ electric pouches is stored inside its membrane and released while it is gliding.
entry_x: They live on treetops and glide using the inside of a cape-like membrane while discharging electricity.
entry_sun: It glides using its cape-like membrane. Electrical energy scatters from it, shocking its friends and foes alike.
entry_sword: As Emolga flutters through the air, it crackles with electricity. This Pokémon is cute, but it can cause a lot of trouble.

name: Karrablast
entry_black: These mysterious Pokémon evolve when they receive electrical stimulation while they are in the same place as Shelmet.
entry_x: These mysterious Pokémon evolve when they receive electrical stimulation while they are in the same place as Shelmet.
entry_sword: Its strange physiology reacts to electrical energy in interesting ways. The presence of a Shelmet will cause this Pokémon to evolve.

name: Escavalier
entry_black: They fly around at high speed, striking with their pointed spears. Even when in trouble, they face opponents bravely.
entry_x: Wearing the shell covering they stole from Shelmet, they defend themselves and attack with two lances.
entry_sword: They use shells they’ve stolen from Shelmet to arm and protect themselves. They’re very popular Pokémon in the Galar region.

name: Foongus
entry_black: It lures people in with its Poké Ball pattern, then releases poison spores. Why it resembles a Poké Ball is unknown.
entry_x: It lures people in with its Poké Ball pattern, then releases poison spores. Why it resembles a Poké Ball is unknown.
entry_sword: No one knows what the Poké Ball–like pattern on Foongus means or why Foongus has it.

name: Amoonguss
entry_black: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a swaying motion.
entry_x: They show off their Poké Ball caps to lure prey, but very few Pokémon are fooled by this.
entry_sword: This Pokémon puffs poisonous spores at its foes. If the spores aren’t washed off quickly, they’ll grow into mushrooms wherever they land.

name: Frillish
entry_black: With its thin, veil-like arms wrapped around the body of its opponent, it sinks to the ocean floor.
entry_x: They paralyze prey with poison, then drag them down to their lairs, five miles below the surface.
entry_sword: It envelops its prey in its veillike arms and draws it down to the deeps, five miles below the ocean’s surface.

name: Jellicent
entry_black: The fate of the ships and crew that wander into Jellicent’s habitat: all sunken, all lost, all vanished.
entry_x: Its body is mostly seawater. It’s said there’s a castle of ships Jellicent have sunk on the seafloor.
entry_sword: Most of this Pokémon’s body composition is identical to sea water. It makes sunken ships its lair.

name: Alomomola
entry_black: The special membrane enveloping Alomomola has the ability to heal wounds.
entry_x: Floating in the open sea is how they live. When they find a wounded Pokémon, they embrace it and bring it to shore.
entry_sun: It uses its special mucus to close the wounds of injured Pokémon. The reason for this behavior remains unknown.

name: Joltik
entry_black: Joltik that live in cities have learned a technique for sucking electricity from the outlets in houses.
entry_x: Since it can’t generate its own electricity, it sticks onto large-bodied Pokémon and absorbs static electricity.
entry_sword: Joltik can be found clinging to other Pokémon. It’s soaking up static electricity because it can’t produce a charge on its own.

name: Galvantula
entry_black: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.
entry_x: They employ an electrically charged web to trap their prey. While it is immobilized by shock, they leisurely consume it.
entry_sword: It launches electrified fur from its abdomen as its means of attack. Opponents hit by the fur could be in for three full days and nights of paralysis.

name: Ferroseed
entry_black: When threatened, it attacks by shooting a barrage of spikes, which gives it a chance to escape by rolling away.
entry_x: When threatened, it attacks by shooting a barrage of spikes, which gives it a chance to escape by rolling away.
entry_sword: It defends itself by launching spikes, but its aim isn’t very good at first. Only after a lot of practice will it improve.

name: Ferrothorn
entry_black: It fights by swinging around its three spiky feelers. A hit from these steel spikes can reduce a boulder to rubble.
entry_x: By swinging around its three spiky feelers and shooting spikes, it can obliterate an opponent.
entry_sword: This Pokémon scrapes its spikes across rocks, and then uses the tips of its feelers to absorb the nutrients it finds within the stone.

name: Klink
entry_black: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.
entry_x: Interlocking two bodies and spinning around generates the energy they need to live.
entry_sword: The two minigears that compose this Pokémon are closer than twins. They mesh well only with each other.

name: Klang
entry_black: By changing the direction in which it rotates, it communicates its feelings to others. When angry, it rotates faster.
entry_x: By changing the direction in which it rotates, it communicates its feelings to others. When angry, it rotates faster.
entry_sword: When Klang goes all out, the minigear links up perfectly with the outer part of the big gear, and this Pokémon’s rotation speed increases sharply.

name: Klinklang
entry_black: Its red core functions as an energy tank. It fires the charged energy through its spikes into an area.
entry_x: The gear with the red core is rotated at high speed for a rapid energy charge.
entry_sword: From its spikes, it launches powerful blasts of electricity. Its red core contains an enormous amount of energy.

name: Tynamo
entry_black: While one alone doesn’t have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.
entry_x: While one alone doesn’t have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.

name: Eelektrik
entry_black: They coil around foes and shock them with electricity-generating organs that seem simply to be circular patterns.
entry_x: It wraps itself around its prey and paralyzes it with electricity from the round spots on its sides. Then it chomps.

name: Eelektross
entry_black: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.
entry_x: With their sucker mouths, they suck in prey. Then they use their fangs to shock the prey with electricity.

name: Elgyem
entry_black: It uses its strong psychic power to squeeze its opponent’s brain, causing unendurable headaches.
entry_x: It uses its strong psychic power to squeeze its opponent’s brain, causing unendurable headaches.
entry_sword: If this Pokémon stands near a TV, strange scenery will appear on the screen. That scenery is said to be from its home.

name: Beheeyem
entry_black: It can manipulate an opponent’s memory. Apparently, it communicates by flashing its three different-colored fingers.
entry_x: Apparently, it communicates by flashing its three fingers, but those patterns haven’t been decoded.
entry_sword: Whenever a Beheeyem visits a farm, a Dubwool mysteriously disappears.

name: Litwick
entry_black: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokémon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.
entry_x: While shining a light and pretending to be a guide, it leeches off the life force of any who follow it.
entry_sword: The flame on its head keeps its body slightly warm. This Pokémon takes lost children by the hand to guide them to the spirit world.

name: Lampent
entry_black: This ominous Pokémon is feared. Through cities it wanders, searching for the spirits of the fallen.
entry_x: The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful fire. It hangs around hospitals waiting for people to pass on.
entry_sword: This Pokémon appears just before someone passes away, so it’s feared as an emissary of death.

name: Chandelure
entry_black: It absorbs a spirit, which it then burns. By waving the flames on its arms, it puts its foes into a hypnotic trance.
entry_x: Being consumed in Chandelure’s flame burns up the spirit, leaving the body behind.
entry_sword: This Pokémon haunts dilapidated mansions. It sways its arms to hypnotize opponents with the ominous dancing of its flames.

name: Axew
entry_black: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. Repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.
entry_x: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. Repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.
entry_sword: These Pokémon nest in the ground and use their tusks to crush hard berries. Crushing berries is also how they test each other’s strength.

name: Fraxure
entry_black: Since a broken tusk will not grow back, they diligently sharpen their tusks on river rocks after they’ve been fighting.
entry_x: Their tusks can shatter rocks. Territory battles between Fraxure can be intensely violent.
entry_sword: After battle, this Pokémon carefully sharpens its tusks on river rocks. It needs to take care of its tusks—if one breaks, it will never grow back.

name: Haxorus
entry_black: They are kind but can be relentless when defending territory. They challenge foes with tusks that can cut steel.
entry_x: They are kind but can be relentless when defending territory. They challenge foes with tusks that can cut steel.
entry_sword: Its resilient tusks are its pride and joy. It licks up dirt to take in the minerals it needs to keep its tusks in top condition.

name: Cubchoo
entry_black: When it is not feeling well, its mucus gets watery and the power of its Ice-type moves decreases.
entry_x: Its nose is always running. It sniffs the snot back up because the mucus provides the raw material for its moves.
entry_sword: When this Pokémon is in good health, its snot becomes thicker and stickier. It will smear its snot on anyone it doesn’t like.

name: Beartic
abilities: Snow Cloak, Slush Rush, Swift Swim
entry_black: It can make its breath freeze at will. Very able in the water, it swims around in northern seas and catches prey.
entry_x: They love the cold seas of the north. They create pathways across the ocean waters by freezing their own breath.
entry_sword: It swims through frigid seas, searching for prey. From its frozen breath, it forms icy fangs that are harder than steel.

name: Cryogonal
entry_black: When its body temperature goes up, it turns into steam and vanishes. When its temperature lowers, it returns to ice.
entry_x: They are born in snow clouds. They use chains made of ice crystals to capture prey.
entry_sword: With its icy chains, Cryogonal freezes those it encounters. It then takes its victims away to somewhere unknown.

name: Shelmet
entry_black: When attacked, it defends itself by closing the lid of its shell. It can spit a sticky, poisonous liquid.
entry_x: When it and Karrablast are together, and both receive electrical stimulation, they both evolve.
entry_sword: When attacked, it tightly shuts the lid of its shell. This reaction fails to protect it from Karrablast, however, because they can still get into the shell.

name: Accelgor
entry_black: When its body dries out, it weakens. So, to prevent dehydration, it wraps itself in many layers of thin membrane.
entry_x: Having removed its heavy shell, it becomes very light and can fight with ninja-like movements.
entry_sword: It moves with blinding speed and lobs poison at foes. Featuring Accelgor as a main character is a surefire way to make a movie or comic popular.

name: Stunfisk
entry_black: Its skin is very hard, so it is unhurt even if stepped on by sumo wrestlers. It smiles when transmitting electricity.
entry_x: Its skin is very hard, so it is unhurt even if stepped on by sumo wrestlers. It smiles when transmitting electricity.
entry_sword: Thanks to bacteria that lived in the mud flats with it, this Pokémon developed the organs it uses to generate electricity.

name: Mienfoo
entry_black: In fights, they dominate with onslaughts of flowing, continuous attacks. With their sharp claws, they cut enemies.
entry_x: It takes pride in the speed at which it can use moves. What it loses in power, it makes up for in quantity.
entry_sword: In one minute, a well-trained Mienfoo can chop with its arms more than 100 times.

name: Mienshao
entry_black: It wields the fur on its arms like a whip. Its arm attacks come with such rapidity that they cannot even be seen.
entry_x: It wields the fur on its arms like a whip. Its arm attacks come with such rapidity that they cannot even be seen.
entry_sword: When Mienshao comes across a truly challenging opponent, it will lighten itself by biting off the fur on its arms.

name: Druddigon
abilities: Rough Skin, Sheer Force, Mold Breaker
entry_black: It warms its body by absorbing sunlight with its wings. When its body temperature falls, it can no longer move.
entry_x: It races through narrow caves, using its sharp claws to catch prey. The skin on its face is harder than a rock.
entry_sword: Druddigon lives in caves, but it never skips sunbathing—it won’t be able to move if its body gets too cold.

name: Golett
entry_black: The energy that burns inside it enables it to move, but no one has yet been able to identify this energy.
entry_x: The energy that burns inside it enables it to move, but no one has yet been able to identify this energy.
entry_sword: They were sculpted from clay in ancient times. No one knows why, but some of them are driven to continually line up boulders.

name: Golurk
entry_black: It flies across the sky at Mach speeds. Removing the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go out of control.
entry_x: It is said that Golurk were ordered to protect people and Pokémon by the ancient people who made them.
entry_sword: Artillery platforms built into the walls of ancient castles served as perches from which Golurk could fire energy beams.

name: Pawniard
entry_black: Blades comprise this Pokémon’s entire body. If battling dulls the blades, it sharpens them on stones by the river.
entry_x: Blades comprise this Pokémon’s entire body. If battling dulls the blades, it sharpens them on stones by the river.
entry_sword: It uses river stones to maintain the cutting edges of the blades covering its body. These sharpened blades allow it to bring down opponents.

name: Bisharp
entry_black: It leads a group of Pawniard. It battles to become the boss, but will be driven from the group if it loses.
entry_x: This pitiless Pokémon commands a group of Pawniard to hound prey into immobility. It then moves in to finish the prey off.
entry_sword: It’s accompanied by a large retinue of Pawniard. Bisharp keeps a keen eye on its minions, ensuring none of them even think of double-crossing it.

name: Bouffalant
entry_black: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.
entry_x: They charge wildly and headbutt everything. Their headbutts have enough destructive force to derail a train.
entry_sword: These Pokémon can crush a car with no more than a headbutt. Bouffalant with more hair on their heads hold higher positions within the herd.

name: Rufflet
entry_black: They crush berries with their talons. They bravely stand up to any opponent, no matter how strong it is.
entry_x: They crush berries with their talons. They bravely stand up to any opponent, no matter how strong it is.
entry_sun: They pick fights indiscriminately. They grow stronger and more powerful each time they faint or are injured.
entry_sword: If it spies a strong Pokémon, Rufflet can’t resist challenging it to a battle. But if Rufflet loses, it starts bawling.

name: Braviary
entry_black: They fight for their friends without any thought about danger to themselves. One can carry a car while flying.
entry_x: For the sake of its friends, this brave warrior of the sky will not stop battling, even if injured.
entry_sun: With its brave disposition, it fears nothing—not even death. Ancient Alolan people respected it, referring to it as “the hero of the sky.”
entry_sword: Known for its bravery and pride, this majestic Pokémon is often seen as a motif for various kinds of emblems.

name: Vullaby
entry_black: Its wings are too tiny to allow it to fly. As the time approaches for it to evolve, it discards the bones it was wearing.
entry_x: Its wings are too tiny to allow it to fly. As the time approaches for it to evolve, it discards the bones it was wearing.
entry_sun: It protects its plump posterior with the bones of prey it has consumed. As it grows, it  replaces the bones.
entry_sword: It wears a bone to protect its rear. It often squabbles with others of its kind over particularly comfy bones.

name: Mandibuzz
entry_black: It makes a nest out of bones it finds. It grabs weakened prey in its talons and hauls it to its nest of bones.
entry_x: They fly in circles around the sky. When they spot prey, they attack and carry it back to their nest with ease.
entry_sun: They adorn themselves beautifully with bones. This is supposedly an effort to attract males, but no male Mandibuzz have ever been found.
entry_sword: Although it’s a bit of a ruffian, this Pokémon will take lost Vullaby under its wing and care for them till they’re ready to leave the nest.

name: Heatmor
entry_black: It breathes through a hole in its tail while it burns with an internal fire. Durant is its prey.
entry_x: Using their very hot, flame-covered tongues, they burn through Durant’s steel bodies and consume their insides.
entry_sword: There’s a hole in its tail that allows it to draw in the air it needs to keep its fire burning. If the hole gets blocked, this Pokémon will fall ill.

name: Durant
entry_black: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.
entry_x: Individuals each play different roles in driving Heatmor, their natural predator, away from their colony.
entry_sword: They lay their eggs deep inside their nests. When attacked by Heatmor, they retaliate using their massive mandibles.

name: Deino
entry_black: It tends to bite everything, and it is not a picky eater. Approaching it carelessly is dangerous.
entry_x: They cannot see, so they tackle and bite to learn about their surroundings. Their bodies are covered in wounds.
entry_sword: When it encounters something, its first urge is usually to bite it. If it likes what it tastes, it will commit the associated scent to memory.

name: Zweilous
entry_black: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.
entry_x: The two heads do not get along. Whichever head eats more than the other gets to be the leader.
entry_sword: While hunting for prey, Zweilous wanders its territory, its two heads often bickering over which way to go.

name: Hydreigon
entry_black: This brutal Pokémon travels the skies on its six wings. Anything that moves seems like a foe to it, triggering its attack.
entry_x: The heads on their arms do not have brains. They use all three heads to consume and destroy everything.
entry_sword: There are a slew of stories about villages that were destroyed by Hydreigon. It bites anything that moves.

name: Larvesta
entry_black: This Pokémon was believed to have been born from the sun. When it evolves, its entire body is engulfed in flames.
entry_x: Said to have been born from the sun, it spews fire from its horns and encases itself in a cocoon of fire when it evolves.
entry_sword: The people of ancient times believed that Larvesta fell from the sun.

name: Volcarona
entry_black: When volcanic ash darkened the atmosphere, it is said that Volcarona’s fire provided a replacement for the sun.
entry_x: A sea of fire engulfs the surroundings of their battles, since they use their six wings to scatter their ember scales.
entry_sword: Volcarona scatters burning scales. Some say it does this to start fires. Others say it’s trying to rescue those that suffer in the cold.

name: Cobalion
entry_black: This legendary Pokémon battled against humans to protect Pokémon. Its personality is calm and composed.
entry_x: It has a body and heart of steel. Its glare is sufficient to make even an unruly Pokémon obey it.
entry_sword: This Pokémon appears in a legend alongside Terrakion and Virizion, fighting against humans in defense of the Unova region’s Pokémon.

name: Terrakion
entry_black: This Pokémon came to the defense of Pokémon that had lost their homes in a war among humans.
entry_x: Its charge is strong enough to break through a giant castle wall in one blow. This Pokémon is spoken of in legends.
entry_sword: It has phenomenal power. It will mercilessly crush anyone or anything that bullies small Pokémon.

name: Virizion
entry_black: This Pokémon fought humans in order to protect its friends. Legends about it continue to be passed down.
entry_x: Its head sprouts horns as sharp as blades. Using whirlwind-like movements, it confounds and swiftly cuts opponents.
entry_sword: A legend tells of this Pokémon working together with Cobalion and Terrakion to protect the Pokémon of the Unova region.

name: Tornadus Incarnate
entry_black: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.
entry_x: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.

name: Thundurus Incarnate
entry_black: Countless charred remains mar the landscape of places through which Thundurus has passed.
entry_x: The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.

name: Reshiram
entry_black: This Pokémon appears in legends. It sends flames into the air from its tail, burning up everything around it.
entry_x: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with fire. It helps those who want to build a world of truth.
entry_sword: Flames spew from its tail as it flies through the sky like a jet airplane. It’s said that this Pokémon will scorch the world.

name: Zekrom
entry_black: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the Unova region. It creates electricity in its tail.
entry_x: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with lightning. It assists those who want to build an ideal world.
entry_sword: When the interior part of its tail spins like a motor, Zekrom can generate many bolts of lightning to blast its surroundings.

name: Landorus Incarnate
entry_black: Lands visited by Landorus grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as “The Guardian of the Fields.”
entry_x: Lands visited by Landorus grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as “The Guardian of the Fields.”

name: Kyurem
entry_black: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.
entry_x: This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.
entry_sword: Dwelling within it is a power even greater than that of Reshiram or Zekrom, but the extreme cold keeps that power bound.

name: Keldeo Ordinary
entry_black: By blasting water from its hooves, it can glide across water. It excels at using leg moves while battling.
entry_x: It crosses the world, running over the surfaces of oceans and rivers. It appears at scenic waterfronts.
entry_sword: Cobalion, Terrakion, and Virizion taught this Pokémon how to fight. It dashes across the world, seeking more opportunities to further its training.

name: Meloetta Aria
entry_black: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.
entry_x: The melodies sung by Meloetta have the power to make Pokémon that hear them happy or sad.

name: Genesect
entry_black: Over 300 million years ago, it was feared as the strongest of hunters. It has been modified by Team Plasma.
entry_x: This ancient bug Pokémon was altered by Team Plasma. They upgraded the cannon on its back.

name: Chespin
entry_x: The quills on its head are usually soft. When it flexes them, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock.

name: Quilladin
entry_x: It relies on its sturdy shell to deflect predators’ attacks. It counterattacks with its sharp quills.

name: Chesnaught
entry_x: Its Tackle is forceful enough to flip a 50-ton tank. It shields its allies from danger with its own body.

name: Fennekin
entry_x: Eating a twig fills it with energy, and its roomy ears give vent to air hotter than 390 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Braixen
entry_x: It has a twig stuck in its tail. With friction from its tail fur, it sets the twig on fire and launches into battle.

name: Delphox
entry_x: It gazes into the flame at the tip of its branch to achieve a focused state, which allows it to see into the future.

name: Froakie
entry_x: It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.

name: Frogadier
entry_x: It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.

name: Greninja
entry_x: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.

name: Bunnelby
entry_x: They use their large ears to dig burrows. They will dig the whole night through.
entry_sword: It excels at digging holes. Using its ears, it can dig a nest 33 feet deep in one night.

name: Diggersby
entry_x: With their powerful ears, they can heft boulders of a ton or more with ease. They can be a big help at construction sites.
entry_sword: With power equal to an excavator, it can dig through dense bedrock. It’s a huge help during tunnel construction.

name: Fletchling
entry_x: These friendly Pokémon send signals to one another with beautiful chirps and tail-feather movements.
entry_sun: This amiable Pokémon is easy to train. But when battle is joined, it shows its ferocious side.
entry_sword: Its melodious cries are actually warnings. Fletchling will mercilessly peck at anything that enters its territory.

name: Fletchinder
entry_x: From its beak, it expels embers that set the tall grass on fire. Then it pounces on the bewildered prey that pop out of the grass.
entry_sun: From its beak, it fires embers at its prey. Once it has caught them, it grills them at high heat before feasting upon them.
entry_sword: Fletchinder launches embers into the den of its prey. When the prey comes leaping out, Fletchinder’s sharp talons finish it off.

name: Talonflame
entry_x: In the fever of an exciting battle, it showers embers from the gaps between its feathers and takes to the air.
entry_sun: Its favorite foods are Wingull and Pikipek. It attacks with a powerful kick and grasps them firmly in its talons.
entry_sword: Talonflame mainly preys upon other bird Pokémon. To intimidate opponents, it sends embers spewing from gaps between its feathers.

name: Scatterbug
abilities: Shield Dust, Compound Eyes, Friend Guard
entry_x: When under attack from bird Pokémon, it spews a poisonous black powder that causes paralysis on contact.

name: Spewpa
entry_x: It lives hidden within thicket shadows. When predators attack, it quickly bristles the fur covering its body in an effort to threaten them.

name: Vivillon
abilities: Shield Dust, Compound Eyes, Friend Guard
entry_x: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.

name: Litleo
entry_x: The stronger the opponent it faces, the more heat surges from its mane and the more power flows through its body.

name: Pyroar
entry_x: The male with the largest mane of fire is the leader of the pride.

name: Flabebe
entry_x: It draws out and controls the hidden power of flowers. The flower Flabébé holds is most likely part of its body.

name: Floette
entry_x: It flutters around fields of flowers and cares for flowers that are starting to wilt. It draws out the hidden power of flowers to battle.

name: Florges
entry_x: It claims exquisite flower gardens as its territory, and it obtains power from basking in the energy emitted by flowering plants.

name: Skiddo
entry_x: Thought to be one of the first Pokémon to live in harmony with humans, it has a placid disposition.

name: Gogoat
entry_x: It can tell how its Trainer is feeling by subtle shifts in the grip on its horns. This empathic sense lets them run as if one being.

name: Pancham
entry_x: It does its best to be taken seriously by its enemies, but its glare is not sufficiently intimidating. Chewing on a leaf is its trademark.
entry_sun: It grows up imitating the behavior of Pangoro, which it looks up to as a leader.
entry_sword: It chooses a Pangoro as its master and then imitates its master’s actions. This is how it learns to battle and hunt for prey.

name: Pangoro
entry_x: Although it possesses a violent temperament, it won’t put up with bullying. It uses the leaf in its mouth to sense the movements of its enemies.
entry_sun: It boasts superb physical strength. Those who wish to become Pangoro’s Trainer have no choice but to converse with their fists.
entry_sword: This Pokémon is quick to anger, and it has no problem using its prodigious strength to get its way. It lives for duels against Obstagoon.

name: Furfrou
entry_x: Trimming its fluffy fur not only makes it more elegant but also increases the swiftness of its movements.

name: Espurr
entry_x: The organ that emits its intense psychic power is sheltered by its ears to keep power from leaking out.
entry_sword: Though Espurr’s expression never changes, behind that blank stare is an intense struggle to contain its devastating psychic power.

name: Meowstic Male
entry_x: When in danger, it raises its ears and releases enough psychic power to grind a 10-ton truck into dust.
entry_sword: Revealing the eyelike patterns on the insides of its ears will unleash its psychic powers. It normally keeps the patterns hidden, however.

name: Honedge
entry_x: Apparently this Pokémon is born when a departed spirit inhabits a sword. It attaches itself to people and drinks their life force.
entry_sword: Honedge’s soul once belonged to a person who was killed a long time ago by the sword that makes up Honedge’s body.

name: Doublade
entry_x: When Honedge evolves, it divides into two swords, which cooperate via telepathy to coordinate attacks and slash their enemies to ribbons.
entry_sword: Honedge evolves into twins. The two blades rub together to emit a metallic sound that unnerves opponents.

name: Aegislash Shield
entry_x: Generations of kings were attended by these Pokémon, which used their spectral power to manipulate and control people and Pokémon.
entry_sword: In this defensive stance, Aegislash uses its steel body and a force field of spectral power to reduce the damage of any attack.

name: Spritzee
entry_x: It emits a scent that enraptures those who smell it. This fragrance changes depending on what it has eaten.
entry_sword: A scent pouch within this Pokémon’s body allows it to create various scents. A change in its diet will alter the fragrance it produces.

name: Aromatisse
entry_x: It devises various scents, pleasant and unpleasant, and emits scents that its enemies dislike in order to gain an edge in battle.
entry_sword: The scent that constantly emits from its fur is so powerful that this Pokémon’s companions will eventually lose their sense of smell.

name: Swirlix
entry_x: To entangle its opponents in battle, it extrudes white threads as sweet and sticky as cotton candy.
entry_sword: It eats its own weight in sugar every day. If it doesn’t get enough sugar, it becomes incredibly grumpy.

name: Slurpuff
entry_x: It can distinguish the faintest of scents. It puts its sensitive sense of smell to use by helping pastry chefs in their work.
entry_sword: By taking in a person’s scent, it can sniff out their mental and physical condition. It’s hoped that this skill will have many medical applications.

name: Inkay
entry_x: Opponents who stare at the flashing of the light-emitting spots on its body become dazed and lose their will to fight.
entry_sword: It spins while making its luminescent spots flash. These spots allow it to communicate with others by using different patterns of light.

name: Malamar
entry_x: It wields the most compelling hypnotic powers of any Pokémon, and it forces others to do whatever it wants.
entry_sword: Gazing at its luminescent spots will quickly induce a hypnotic state, putting the observer under Malamar’s control.

name: Binacle
entry_x: Two Binacle live together on one rock. When they fight, one of them will move to a different rock.
entry_sword: After two Binacle find a suitably sized rock, they adhere themselves to it and live together. They cooperate to gather food during high tide.

name: Barbaracle
entry_x: When they evolve, two Binacle multiply into seven. They fight with the power of seven Binacle.
entry_sword: Seven Binacle come together to form one Barbaracle. The Binacle that serves as the head gives orders to those serving as the limbs.

name: Skrelp
entry_x: Camouflaged as rotten kelp, they spray liquid poison on prey that approaches unawares and then finish it off.
entry_sword: It drifts in the ocean, blending in with floating seaweed. When other Pokémon come to feast on the seaweed, Skrelp feasts on them instead.

name: Dragalge
entry_x: Their poison is strong enough to eat through the hull of a tanker, and they spit it indiscriminately at anything that enters their territory.
entry_sword: Dragalge uses a poisonous liquid capable of corroding metal to send tankers that enter its territory to the bottom of the sea.

name: Clauncher
entry_x: They knock down flying prey by firing compressed water from their massive claws like shooting a pistol.
entry_sword: Clauncher’s claws can fall off during battle, but they’ll regenerate. The meat inside the claws is popular as a delicacy in Galar.

name: Clawitzer
entry_x: Their enormous claws launch cannonballs of water powerful enough to pierce tanker hulls.
entry_sword: After using the feelers on its oversized claw to detect the location of prey, Clawitzer launches a cannonball of water at its target.

name: Helioptile
abilities: Dry Skin, Sand Veil, Solar Power
entry_x: They make their home in deserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.
entry_sword: When spread, the frills on its head act like solar panels, generating the power behind this Pokémon’s electric moves.

name: Heliolisk
abilities: Dry Skin, Sand Veil, Solar Power
entry_x: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.
entry_sword: A now-vanished desert culture treasured these Pokémon. Appropriately, when Heliolisk came to the Galar region, treasure came with them.

name: Tyrunt
entry_x: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. If something happens that it doesn’t like, it throws a tantrum and runs wild.
entry_sword: This is an ancient Pokémon, revived in modern times. It has a violent disposition, and it’ll tear apart anything it gets between its hefty jaws.

name: Tyrantrum
entry_x: Thanks to its gargantuan jaws, which could shred thick metal plates as if they were paper, it was invincible in the ancient world it once inhabited.
entry_sword: This Pokémon is from about 100,000,000 years ago. It has the presence of a king, vicious but magnificent.

name: Amaura
entry_x: This ancient Pokémon was restored from part of its body that had been frozen in ice for over 100 million years.
entry_sword: This Pokémon was successfully restored from a fossil. In the past, it lived with others of its kind in cold lands where there were fewer predators.

name: Aurorus
entry_x: The diamond-shaped crystals on its body expel air as cold as -240 degrees Fahrenheit, surrounding its enemies and encasing them in ice.
entry_sword: Aurorus was restored from a fossil. It’s said that when this Pokémon howls, auroras appear in the night sky.

name: Sylveon
entry_x: It sends a soothing aura from its ribbonlike feelers to calm fights.
entry_sun: Its ribbonlike feelers give off an aura that weakens hostility in its prey, causing them to let down their guard. Then it attacks.
entry_sword: By releasing enmity-erasing waves from its ribbonlike feelers, Sylveon stops any conflict.

name: Hawlucha
entry_x: Although its body is small, its proficient fighting skills enable it to keep up with big bruisers like Machamp and Hariyama.
entry_sword: It drives its opponents to exhaustion with its agile maneuvers, then ends the fight with a flashy finishing move.

name: Dedenne
entry_x: Its whiskers serve as antennas. By sending and receiving electrical waves, it can communicate with others over vast distances.
entry_sword: A Dedenne’s whiskers pick up electrical waves other Dedenne send out. These Pokémon share locations of food or electricity with one another.

name: Carbink
entry_x: Born from the temperatures and pressures deep underground, it fires beams from the stone in its head.
entry_sun: Born from the high temperatures and pressures deep underground, it defends itself by firing beams from the jewel part of its body.
entry_sword: When beset by attackers, Carbink wipes them all out by firing high-energy beams from the gems embedded in its body.

name: Goomy
entry_x: The weakest Dragon-type Pokémon, it lives in damp, shady places, so its body doesn’t dry out.
entry_sun: The weakest of all Dragon-type Pokémon, it’s unable to breathe if its skin dries out, so it sticks to shady places.
entry_sword: Because most of its body is water, it will dry up if the weather becomes too arid. It’s considered the weakest dragon Pokémon.

name: Sliggoo
entry_x: It drives away opponents by excreting a sticky liquid that can dissolve anything. Its eyes devolved, so it can’t see anything.
entry_sun: It has trouble drawing a line between friends and food. It will calmly try to melt and eat even those it gets along well with.
entry_sword: Although this Pokémon isn’t very strong, its body is coated in a caustic slime that can melt through anything, so predators steer clear of it.

name: Goodra
entry_x: This very friendly Dragon-type Pokémon will hug its beloved Trainer, leaving that Trainer covered in sticky slime.
entry_sun: An amazingly friendly Pokémon, but if left to itself, loneliness overcomes it, and it oozes gooey tears.
entry_sword: Sometimes it misunderstands instructions and appears dazed or bewildered. Many Trainers don’t mind, finding this behavior to be adorable.

name: Klefki
entry_x: These key collectors threaten any attackers by fiercely jingling their keys at them.
entry_sun: This even-tempered Pokémon has a habit of collecting keys. It will sneak into people’s homes to steal their keys.
entry_sword: This Pokémon is constantly collecting keys. Entrust a Klefki with important keys, and the Pokémon will protect them no matter what.

name: Phantump
entry_x: These Pokémon are created when spirits possess rotten tree stumps. They prefer to live in abandoned forests.
entry_sun: These Pokémon are stumps possessed by the spirits of children who died in the forest. Their cries sound like eerie screams.
entry_sword: After a lost child perished in the forest, their spirit possessed a tree stump, causing the spirit’s rebirth as this Pokémon.

name: Trevenant
entry_x: It can control trees at will. It will trap people who harm the forest, so they can never leave.
entry_sun: This Pokémon is said to devour anyone daring to ravage the forest. To the creatures dwelling in the forest, it offers great kindness.
entry_sword: People fear it due to a belief that it devours any who try to cut down trees in its forest, but to the Pokémon it shares its woods with, it’s kind.

name: Pumpkaboo Average
entry_x: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.
entry_sword: Spirits that wander this world are placed into Pumpkaboo’s body. They’re then moved on to the afterlife.

name: Gourgeist Average
entry_x: Singing in eerie voices, they wander town streets on the night of the new moon. Anyone who hears their song is cursed.
entry_sword: Eerie cries emanate from its body in the dead of night. The sounds are said to be the wails of spirits who are suffering in the afterlife.

name: Bergmite
entry_x: It blocks opponents’ attacks with the ice that shields its body. It uses cold air to repair any cracks with new ice.
entry_sword: They chill the air around them to −150 degrees Fahrenheit, freezing the water in the air into ice that they use as armor.

name: Avalugg
entry_x: Its ice-covered body is as hard as steel. Its cumbersome frame crushes anything that stands in its way.
entry_sword: At high latitudes, this Pokémon can be found with clusters of Bergmite on its back as it swims among the icebergs.

name: Noibat
entry_x: They live in pitch-black caves. Their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.
entry_sword: After nightfall, they emerge from the caves they nest in during the day. Using their ultrasonic waves, they go on the hunt for ripened fruit.

name: Noivern
entry_x: They fly around on moonless nights and attack careless prey. Nothing can beat them in a battle in the dark.
entry_sword: Aggressive and cruel, this Pokémon will ruthlessly torment enemies that are helpless in the dark.

name: Xerneas
entry_x: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.

name: Yveltal
entry_x: When this legendary Pokémon’s wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.

name: Zygarde 50
entry_x: When the Kalos region’s ecosystem falls into disarray, it appears and reveals its secret power.
entry_sun: This is Zygarde’s form when it has gathered 50% of its cells. It wipes out all those who oppose it, showing not a shred of mercy.

name: Diancie
entry_x: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.

name: Hoopa
entry_x: This troublemaker sends anything and everything to faraway places using its loop, which can warp space.

name: Volcanion
entry_x: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It’s said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.

name: Rowlet
entry_sun: This wary Pokémon uses photosynthesis to store up energy during the day, while becoming active at night.
entry_sword: At a distance, it launches its sharp feathers while flying about. If the enemy gets too close, Rowlet switches tactics and delivers vicious kicks.

name: Dartrix
entry_sun: A bit of a dandy, it spends its free time preening its wings. Its preoccupation with any dirt on its plumage can leave it unable to battle.
entry_sword: It throws one knifelike feather after another at its enemies, and each one precisely strikes a weak point. These feathers are known as blade quills.

name: Decidueye
entry_sun: It fires arrow quills from its wings with such precision, they can pierce a pebble at distances over a hundred yards.
entry_sword: As if wielding a bow, it launches the arrow quills hidden among the feathers of its wings. Decidueye’s shots never miss.

name: Litten
entry_sun: While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.
entry_sword: It spends even the smallest amount of downtime grooming its fur with its tongue. Loose fur gathers in its stomach and serves as fuel for fiery moves.

name: Torracat
entry_sun: At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. The bell rings brightly whenever this Pokémon spits fire.
entry_sword: In the midst of battle, the fire pouch on Torracat’s neck rings like a bell and produces stronger flames than usual.

name: Incineroar
entry_sun: This Pokémon has a violent, selfish disposition. If it’s not in the mood to listen, it will ignore its Trainer’s orders with complete nonchalance.
entry_sword: It excels at violent, no-holds-barred battles. The temperature of the flames that issue from its navel exceeds 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Popplio
entry_sun: This Pokémon snorts body fluids from its nose, blowing balloons to smash into its foes. It’s famous for being a hard worker.
entry_sword: It creates special bouncy balloons to send at its opponents. When the balloons pop, the sheer force of their bursting is what deals damage.

name: Brionne
entry_sun: A skillful dancer, it creates a sequence of water balloons as it dances, and briskly bombards its enemies.
entry_sword: As if dancing, it artfully dodges the attacks of its enemies. All the while, it’s busy forming a bunch of balloons to overwhelm its foes.

name: Primarina
entry_sun: It controls its water balloons with song. The melody is learned from others of its kind and is passed down from one generation to the next.
entry_sword: With its mouth, it makes sonic waves that sound like beautiful singing. It uses the sonic waves to control its water balloons.

name: Pikipek
entry_sun: It can peck at a rate of 16 times a second to drill holes in trees. It uses the holes for food storage and for nesting.

name: Trumbeak
entry_sun: It eats berries and stores their seeds in its beak. When it encounters enemies or prey, it fires off all the seeds in a burst.

name: Toucannon
abilities: Keen Eye, Skill Link, Sheer Force
entry_sun: When it battles, its beak heats up. The temperature can easily exceed 212 degrees Fahrenheit, causing severe burns when it hits.

name: Yungoos
entry_sun: With its sharp fangs, it will bite anything. It did not originally live in Alola but was imported from another region.

name: Gumshoos
entry_sun: When it finds a trace of its prey, it patiently stakes out the location...but it’s always snoozing by nightfall.

name: Grubbin
entry_sun: Its strong jaw enables it to scrape trees and slurp out the sap. It normally lives underground.
entry_sword: Its natural enemies, like Rookidee, may flee rather than risk getting caught in its large mandibles that can snap thick tree branches.

name: Charjabug
entry_sun: Its body is capable of storing electricity. On camping trips, people are grateful to have one around.
entry_sword: While its durable shell protects it from attacks, Charjabug strikes at enemies with jolts of electricity discharged from the tips of its jaws.

name: Vikavolt
entry_sun: It zips around, on sharp lookout for an opening. It concentrates electrical energy within its large jaws and uses it to zap its enemies.
entry_sword: It builds up electricity in its abdomen, focuses it through its jaws, and then fires the electricity off in concentrated beams.

name: Crabrawler
abilities: Hyper Cutter, Iron Fist, Anger Point
entry_sun: While guarding its weak points with its pincers, it looks for an opening and unleashes punches. When it loses, it foams at the mouth and faints.

name: Crabominable
abilities: Hyper Cutter, Iron Fist, Anger Point
entry_sun: It aimed for the top but got lost and ended up on a snowy mountain. Being forced to endure the cold, this Pokémon evolved and grew fur.

name: Oricorio Baile
entry_sun: It beats its wings together to create fire. As it moves in the steps of its beautiful dance, it bathes opponents in intense flames.

name: Cutiefly
abilities: Honey Gather, Shield Dust, Sweet Veil
entry_sun: It feeds on the nectar and pollen of flowers. Because it’s able to sense auras, it can identify which flowers are about to bloom.
entry_sword: Nectar and pollen are its favorite fare. You can find Cutiefly hovering around Gossifleur, trying to get some of Gossifleur’s pollen.

name: Ribombee
abilities: Honey Gather, Shield Dust, Sweet Veil
entry_sun: It rolls up pollen into puffs. It makes many different varieties, some used as food and others used in battle.
entry_sword: It makes pollen puffs from pollen and nectar. The puffs’ effects depend on the type of ingredients and how much of each one is used.

name: Rockruff
entry_sun: It’s considered to be a good Pokémon for beginners because of its friendliness, but its disposition grows rougher as it grows up.
entry_sword: This Pokémon can bond very strongly with its Trainer, but it also has a habit of biting. Raising a Rockruff for a long time can be challenging.

name: Lycanroc Midday
entry_sun: Its quick movements confuse its enemies. Well equipped with claws and fangs, it also uses the sharp rocks in its mane as weapons.
entry_sword: This Lycanroc is calm and cautious. The rocks jutting from its mane are razor sharp.

name: Wishiwashi Solo
entry_sun: When it’s in trouble, its eyes moisten and begin to shine. The shining light attracts its comrades, and they stand together against their enemies.
entry_sword: Individually, they’re incredibly weak. It’s by gathering up into schools that they’re able to confront opponents.

name: Mareanie
entry_sun: It plunges the poison spike on its head into its prey. When the prey has weakened, Mareanie deals the finishing blow with its 10 tentacles.
entry_sword: The first symptom of its sting is numbness. The next is an itching sensation so intense that it’s impossible to resist the urge to claw at your skin.

name: Toxapex
entry_sun: Toxapex crawls along the ocean floor on its 12 legs. It leaves a trail of Corsola bits scattered in its wake.
entry_sword: To survive in the cold waters of Galar, this Pokémon forms a dome with its legs, enclosing its body so it can capture its own body heat.

name: Mudbray
entry_sun: The mud stuck to Mudbray’s hooves enhances its grip and its powerful running gait.
entry_sword: Loads weighing up to 50 times as much as its own body weight pose no issue for this Pokémon. It’s skilled at making use of mud.

name: Mudsdale
entry_sun: It spits a mud that provides resistance to both wind and rain, so the walls of old houses were often coated with it.
entry_sword: Mud that hardens around a Mudsdale’s legs sets harder than stone. It’s so hard that it allows this Pokémon to scrap a truck with a single kick.

name: Dewpider
entry_sun: It crawls onto the land in search of food. Its water bubble allows it to breathe and protects its soft head.
entry_sword: It forms a water bubble at the rear of its body and then covers its head with it. Meeting another Dewpider means comparing water-bubble sizes.

name: Araquanid
entry_sun: It delivers headbutts with the water bubble on its head. Small Pokémon get sucked into the bubble, where they drown.
entry_sword: It launches water bubbles with its legs, drowning prey within the bubbles. This Pokémon can then take its time to savor its meal.

name: Fomantis
entry_sun: During the day, it sleeps and soaks up light. When night falls, it walks around looking for a safer place to sleep.
entry_sword: When bathed in sunlight, this Pokémon emits a pleasantly sweet scent, which causes bug Pokémon to gather around it.

name: Lurantis
entry_sun: It requires a lot of effort to maintain Lurantis’s vivid coloring, but some collectors enjoy this work and treat it as their hobby.
entry_sword: This Pokémon resembles a beautiful flower. A properly raised Lurantis will have gorgeous, brilliant colors.

name: Morelull
entry_sun: It scatters spores that flicker and glow. Anyone seeing these lights falls into a deep slumber.
entry_sword: Pokémon living in the forest eat the delicious caps on Morelull’s head. The caps regrow overnight.

name: Shiinotic
entry_sun: Forests where Shiinotic live are treacherous to enter at night. People confused by its strange lights can never find their way home again.
entry_sword: Its flickering spores lure in prey and put them to sleep. Once this Pokémon has its prey snoozing, it drains their vitality with its fingertips.

name: Salandit
entry_sun: It burns its bodily fluids to create a poisonous gas. When its enemies become disoriented from inhaling the gas, it attacks them.
entry_sword: Its venom sacs produce a fluid that this Pokémon then heats up with the flame in its tail. This process creates Salandit’s poisonous gas.

name: Salazzle
entry_sun: For some reason, only females have been found. It creates a reverse harem of male Salandit that it lives with.
entry_sword: Only female Salazzle exist. They emit a gas laden with pheromones to captivate male Salandit.

name: Stufful
entry_sun: Despite its adorable appearance, when it gets angry and flails about, its arms and legs could knock a pro wrestler sprawling.
entry_sword: Its fluffy fur is a delight to pet, but carelessly reaching out to touch this Pokémon could result in painful retaliation.

name: Bewear
entry_sun: This immensely dangerous Pokémon possesses overwhelming physical strength. Its habitat is generally off-limits.
entry_sword: Once it accepts you as a friend, it tries to show its affection with a hug. Letting it do that is dangerous—it could easily shatter your bones.

name: Bounsweet
entry_sun: A delectable aroma pours from its body. They are often swallowed whole by Toucannon lured by that wafting deliciousness.
entry_sword: Its body gives off a sweet, fruity scent that is extremely appetizing to bird Pokémon.

name: Steenee
entry_sun: The sepals on its head developed to protect its body. These are quite hard, so even if pecked by bird Pokémon, this Pokémon is totally fine.
entry_sword: As it twirls like a dancer, a sweet smell spreads out around it. Anyone who inhales the scent will feel a surge of happiness.

name: Tsareena
abilities: Leaf Guard, Queenly Majesty, Sweet Veil
entry_sun: Its long, striking legs aren’t just for show but to be used to kick with skill. In victory, it shows off by kicking the defeated, laughing boisterously.
entry_sword: This feared Pokémon has long, slender legs and a cruel heart. It shows no mercy as it stomps on its opponents.

name: Comfey
entry_sun: It attaches flowers to its highly nutritious vine. This revitalizes the flowers, and they give off an aromatic scent.
entry_sword: Comfey picks flowers with its vine and decorates itself with them. For some reason, flowers won’t wither once they’re attached to a Comfey.

name: Oranguru
entry_sun: Known for its extreme intelligence, this Pokémon will look down on inexperienced Trainers, so it’s best suited to veteran Trainers.
entry_sword: With waves of its fan—made from leaves and its own fur—Oranguru skillfully gives instructions to other Pokémon.

name: Passimian
entry_sun: They form groups of roughly 20 individuals. Their mutual bond is remarkable—they will never let down a comrade.
entry_sword: Displaying amazing teamwork, they follow the orders of their boss as they all help out in the search for their favorite berries.

name: Wimpod
entry_sun: This Pokémon is a coward. As it desperately dashes off, the flailing of its many legs leaves a sparkling clean path in its wake.
entry_sword: It’s nature’s cleaner—it eats anything and everything, including garbage and rotten things. The ground near its nest is always clean.

name: Golisopod
entry_sun: With a flashing slash of its giant sharp claws, it cleaves seawater—or even air—right in two.
entry_sword: It will do anything to win, taking advantage of every opening and finishing opponents off with the small claws on its front legs.

name: Sandygast
entry_sun: Born from a sand mound playfully built by a child, this Pokémon embodies the grudges of the departed.
entry_sword: Grudges of the dead have possessed a mound of sand and become a Pokémon. Sandygast is fond of the shovel on its head.

name: Palossand
entry_sun: Possessed people controlled by this Pokémon transformed its sand mound into a castle. As it evolved, its power to curse grew ever stronger.
entry_sword: Palossand is known as the Beach Nightmare. It pulls its prey down into the sand by controlling the sand itself, and then it sucks out their souls.

name: Pyukumuku
entry_sun: It lives in shallow seas, such as areas near a beach. It can eject its internal organs, which it uses to engulf its prey or battle enemies.
entry_sword: It lives in warm, shallow waters. If it encounters a foe, it will spit out its internal organs as a means to punch them.

name: Type Null
entry_sun: The heavy control mask it wears suppresses its intrinsic capabilities. This Pokémon has some hidden special power.
entry_sword: Rumor has it that the theft of top-secret research notes led to a new instance of this Pokémon being created in the Galar region.

name: Silvally
entry_sun: Its trust in its partner is what awakens it. This Pokémon is capable of changing its type, a flexibility that is well displayed in battle.
entry_sword: A solid bond of trust between this Pokémon and its Trainer awakened the strength hidden within Silvally. It can change its type at will.

name: Minior Red Meteor
entry_sun: Originally making its home in the ozone layer, it hurtles to the ground when the shell enclosing its body grows too heavy.

name: Komala
entry_sun: It is born asleep, and it dies asleep. All its movements are apparently no more than the results of it tossing and turning in its dreams.

name: Turtonator
entry_sun: The shell on its back is chemically unstable and explodes violently if struck. The hole in its stomach is its weak point.
entry_sword: Explosive substances coat the shell on its back. Enemies that dare attack it will be blown away by an immense detonation.

name: Togedemaru
entry_sun: The spiny fur on its back is normally at rest. When this Pokémon becomes agitated, its fur stands on end and stabs into its attackers.
entry_sword: With the long hairs on its back, this Pokémon takes in electricity from other electric Pokémon. It stores what it absorbs in an electric sac.

name: Mimikyu Disguised
entry_sun: Its actual appearance is unknown. A scholar who saw what was under its rag was overwhelmed by terror and died from the shock.
entry_sword: It wears a rag fashioned into a Pikachu costume in an effort to look less scary. Unfortunately, the costume only makes it creepier.

name: Bruxish
entry_sun: When it unleashes its psychic power from the protuberance on its head, the grating sound of grinding teeth echoes through the area.

name: Drampa
entry_sun: It has a compassionate personality, but if it is angered, it completely destroys its surroundings with its intense breath.
entry_sword: The mountains it calls home are nearly two miles in height. On rare occasions, it descends to play with the children living in the towns below.

name: Dhelmise
entry_sun: Swinging its massive anchor, it can KO Wailord in a single blow. What appears to be green seaweed is actually its body.
entry_sword: After a piece of seaweed merged with debris from a sunken ship, it was reborn as this ghost Pokémon.

name: Jangmo O
entry_sun: It expresses its feelings by smacking its scales. Metallic sounds echo through the tall mountains where Jangmo-o lives.
entry_sword: They learn to fight by smashing their head scales together. The dueling strengthens both their skills and their spirits.

name: Hakamo O
entry_sun: It leaps at its prey with a courageous shout. Its scaly punches tear its opponents to shreds.
entry_sword: The scaleless, scarred parts of its body are signs of its strength. It shows them off to defeated opponents.

name: Kommo O
entry_sun: When it spots enemies, it threatens them by jingling the scales on its tail. Weak opponents will crack and flee in panic.
entry_sword: It clatters its tail scales to unnerve opponents. This Pokémon will battle only those who stand steadfast in the face of this display.

name: Tapu Koko
entry_sun: This guardian deity of Melemele is brimming with curiosity. It summons thunderclouds and stores their lightning inside its body.

name: Tapu Lele
entry_sun: This guardian deity of Akala is guilelessly cruel. The fragrant aroma of flowers is the source of its energy.

name: Tapu Bulu
entry_sun: It pulls large trees up by the roots and swings them around. It causes vegetation to grow, and then it absorbs energy from the growth.

name: Tapu Fini
entry_sun: The dense fog it creates brings the downfall and destruction of its confused enemies. Ocean currents are the source of its energy.

name: Cosmog
entry_sun: Its body is gaseous and frail. It slowly grows as it collects dust from the atmosphere.
entry_sword: This Pokémon came from another universe. Its gaseous body is so light that even a gentle breeze can blow it away.

name: Cosmoem
entry_sun: Motionless as if dead, its body is faintly warm to the touch. In the distant past, it was called the cocoon of the stars.
entry_sword: The absorption of starlight fuels this Pokémon’s growth. The shell that encases it is harder than any known material.

name: Solgaleo
entry_sun: It is said to live in another world. The intense light it radiates from the surface of its body can make the darkest of nights light up like midday.
entry_sword: When light radiates from its body, this Pokémon could almost appear to be the sun. It will dispel any darkness and light up the world.

name: Lunala
entry_sun: It is said to be a female evolution of Cosmog. When its third eye activates, away it flies to another world.
entry_sword: Known as the Beast That Calls the Moon, this Pokémon lives by taking in any and all light and converting it into its own energy.

name: Nihilego
entry_sun: One of several mysterious Ultra Beasts. People on the street report observing those infested by it suddenly becoming violent.

name: Buzzwole
entry_sun: This Ultra Beast appeared from another world. It shows off its body, but whether that display is a boast or a threat remains unclear.

name: Pheromosa
entry_sun: One of the dangerous Ultra Beasts, it has been spotted running across the land at terrific speeds.

name: Xurkitree
entry_sun: One of the mysterious life-forms known as Ultra Beasts. Astonishing electric shocks emanate from its entire body, according to witnesses.

name: Celesteela
entry_sun: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. Witnesses observed it flying across the sky at high speed.

name: Kartana
entry_sun: This Ultra Beast came from the Ultra Wormhole. It seems not to attack enemies on its own, but its sharp body is a dangerous weapon in itself.

name: Guzzlord
entry_sun: It has gobbled mountains and swallowed whole buildings, according to reports. It’s one of the Ultra Beasts.

name: Necrozma
entry_sun: Reminiscent of the Ultra Beasts, this life-form, apparently asleep underground, is thought to have come from another world in ancient times.
entry_sword: It survives by absorbing light. After a long time spent slumbering underground, impurities accumulated within it, causing its body to darken.

name: Magearna
entry_sun: This artificial Pokémon, constructed more than 500 years ago, can understand human speech but cannot itself speak.

name: Marshadow
entry_sun: Able to conceal itself in shadows, it never appears before humans, so its very existence was the stuff of myth.
entry_sword: By slipping into the shadow of a martial arts master and copying their movements, this Pokémon learned the ultimate techniques.

name: Zeraora
entry_sword: It runs as fast as lightning strikes, shredding its opponents with its high-voltage claws.

name: Meltan
entry_sword: It dissolves and eats metal. Circulating liquid metal within its body is how it generates energy.

name: Melmetal
entry_sword: At the end of its life-span, Melmetal will rust and fall apart. The small shards left behind will eventually be reborn as Meltan.

name: Grookey
entry_sword: When it uses its special stick to strike up a beat, the sound waves produced carry revitalizing energy to the plants and flowers in the area.

name: Thwackey
entry_sword: The faster a Thwackey can beat out a rhythm with its two sticks, the more respect it wins from its peers.

name: Rillaboom
entry_sword: By drumming, it taps into the power of its special tree stump. The roots of the stump follow its direction in battle.

name: Scorbunny
entry_sword: A warm-up of running around gets fire energy coursing through this Pokémon’s body. Once that happens, it’s ready to fight at full power.

name: Raboot
entry_sword: Its thick and fluffy fur protects it from the cold and enables it to use hotter fire moves.

name: Cinderace
entry_sword: It juggles a pebble with its feet, turning it into a burning soccer ball. Its shots strike opponents hard and leave them scorched.

name: Sobble
entry_sword: When scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers won’t be able to resist weeping.

name: Drizzile
entry_sword: A clever combatant, this Pokémon battles using water balloons created with moisture secreted from its palms.

name: Inteleon
entry_sword: It has many hidden capabilities, such as fingertips that can shoot water and a membrane on its back that it can use to glide through the air.

name: Skwovet
entry_sword: Found throughout the Galar region, this Pokémon becomes uneasy if its cheeks are ever completely empty of berries.

name: Greedent
entry_sword: It stashes berries in its tail—so many berries that they fall out constantly. But this Pokémon is a bit slow-witted, so it doesn’t notice the loss.

name: Rookidee
entry_sword: It will bravely challenge any opponent, no matter how powerful. This Pokémon benefits from every battle—even a defeat increases its strength a bit.

name: Corvisquire
entry_sword: Smart enough to use tools in battle, these Pokémon have been seen picking up rocks and flinging them or using ropes to wrap up enemies.

name: Corviknight
entry_sword: This Pokémon reigns supreme in the skies of the Galar region. The black luster of its steel body could drive terror into the heart of any foe.

name: Blipbug
entry_sword: A constant collector of information, this Pokémon is very smart. Very strong is what it isn’t.

name: Dottler
entry_sword: It barely moves, but it’s still alive. Hiding in its shell without food or water seems to have awakened its psychic powers.

name: Orbeetle
entry_sword: It’s famous for its high level of intelligence, and the large size of its brain is proof that it also possesses immense psychic power.

name: Nickit
entry_sword: Aided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids the food stores of other Pokémon. It survives off its ill-gotten gains.

name: Thievul
entry_sword: It secretly marks potential targets with a scent. By following the scent, it stalks its targets and steals from them when they least expect it.

name: Gossifleur
entry_sword: It anchors itself in the ground with its single leg, then basks in the sun. After absorbing enough sunlight, its petals spread as it blooms brilliantly.

name: Eldegoss
entry_sword: The seeds attached to its cotton fluff are full of nutrients. It spreads them on the wind so that plants and other Pokémon can benefit from them.

name: Wooloo
entry_sword: Its curly fleece is such an effective cushion that this Pokémon could fall off a cliff and stand right back up at the bottom, unharmed.

name: Dubwool
entry_sword: Weave a carpet from its springy wool, and you end up with something closer to a trampoline. You’ll start to bounce the moment you set foot on it.

name: Chewtle
abilities: Strong Jaw, Shell Armor, Swift Swim
entry_sword: Apparently the itch of its teething impels it to snap its jaws at anything in front of it.

name: Drednaw
abilities: Strong Jaw, Shell Armor, Swift Swim
entry_sword: With jaws that can shear through steel rods, this highly aggressive Pokémon chomps down on its unfortunate prey.

name: Yamper
entry_sword: This Pokémon is very popular as a herding dog in the Galar region. As it runs, it generates electricity from the base of its tail.

name: Boltund
entry_sword: This Pokémon generates electricity and channels it into its legs to keep them going strong. Boltund can run nonstop for three full days.

name: Rolycoly
entry_sword: Most of its body has the same composition as coal. Fittingly, this Pokémon was first discovered in coal mines about 400 years ago.

name: Carkol
abilities: Steam Engine, Flame Body, Flash Fire
entry_sword: It forms coal inside its body. Coal dropped by this Pokémon once helped fuel the lives of people in the Galar region.

name: Coalossal
abilities: Steam Engine, Flame Body, Flash Fire
entry_sword: It’s usually peaceful, but the vandalism of mines enrages it. Offenders will be incinerated with flames that reach 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Applin
entry_sword: It spends its entire life inside an apple. It hides from its natural enemies, bird Pokémon, by pretending it’s just an apple and nothing more.

name: Flapple
entry_sword: It ate a sour apple, and that induced its evolution. In its cheeks, it stores an acid capable of causing chemical burns.

name: Appletun
entry_sword: Eating a sweet apple caused its evolution. A nectarous scent wafts from its body, luring in the bug Pokémon it preys on.

name: Silicobra
abilities: Sand Spit, Shed Skin, Sand Veil
entry_sword: As it digs, it swallows sand and stores it in its neck pouch. The pouch can hold more than 17 pounds of sand.

name: Sandaconda
abilities: Sand Spit, Shed Skin, Sand Veil
entry_sword: When it contracts its body, over 220 pounds of sand sprays from its nose. If it ever runs out of sand, it becomes disheartened.

name: Cramorant
entry_sword: It’s so strong that it can knock out some opponents in a single hit, but it also may forget what it’s battling midfight.

name: Arrokuda
entry_sword: If it sees any movement around it, this Pokémon charges for it straightaway, leading with its sharply pointed jaw. It’s very proud of that jaw.

name: Barraskewda
entry_sword: This Pokémon has a jaw that’s as sharp as a spear and as strong as steel. Apparently Barraskewda’s flesh is surprisingly tasty, too.

name: Toxel
entry_sword: It stores poison in an internal poison sac and secretes that poison through its skin. If you touch this Pokémon, a tingling sensation follows.

name: Toxtricity Amped
entry_sword: When this Pokémon sounds as if it’s strumming a guitar, it’s actually clawing at the protrusions on its chest to generate electricity.

name: Sizzlipede
abilities: Flash Fire, White Smoke, Flame Body
entry_sword: It stores flammable gas in its body and uses it to generate heat. The yellow sections on its belly get particularly hot.

name: Centiskorch
abilities: Flash Fire, White Smoke, Flame Body
entry_sword: When it heats up, its body temperature reaches about 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. It lashes its body like a whip and launches itself at enemies.

name: Clobbopus
entry_sword: It’s very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.

name: Grapploct
entry_sword: A body made up of nothing but muscle makes the grappling moves this Pokémon performs with its tentacles tremendously powerful.

name: Sinistea
entry_sword: This Pokémon is said to have been born when a lonely spirit possessed a cold, leftover cup of tea.

name: Polteageist
entry_sword: This species lives in antique teapots. Most pots are forgeries, but on rare occasions, an authentic work is found.

name: Hatenna
entry_sword: Via the protrusion on its head, it senses other creatures’ emotions. If you don’t have a calm disposition, it will never warm up to you.

name: Hattrem
entry_sword: No matter who you are, if you bring strong emotions near this Pokémon, it will silence you violently.

name: Hatterene
entry_sword: It emits psychic power strong enough to cause headaches as a deterrent to the approach of others.

name: Impidimp
entry_sword: Through its nose, it sucks in the emanations produced by people and Pokémon when they feel annoyed. It thrives off this negative energy.

name: Morgrem
entry_sword: When it gets down on all fours as if to beg for forgiveness, it’s trying to lure opponents in so that it can stab them with its spear-like hair.

name: Grimmsnarl
entry_sword: With the hair wrapped around its body helping to enhance its muscles, this Pokémon can overwhelm even Machamp.

name: Obstagoon
entry_sword: Its voice is staggering in volume. Obstagoon has a tendency to take on a threatening posture and shout—this move is known as Obstruct.

name: Perrserker
abilities: Battle Armor, Tough Claws, Steely Spirit
entry_sword: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.

name: Cursola
entry_sword: Its shell is overflowing with its heightened otherworldly energy. The ectoplasm serves as protection for this Pokémon’s core spirit.

name: Sirfetchd
entry_sword: Only Farfetch’d that have survived many battles can attain this evolution. When this Pokémon’s leek withers, it will retire from combat.

name: Mr Rime
abilities: Tangled Feet, Screen Cleaner, Ice Body
entry_sword: It’s highly skilled at tap-dancing. It waves its cane of ice in time with its graceful movements.

name: Runerigus
entry_sword: A powerful curse was woven into an ancient painting. After absorbing the spirit of a Yamask, the painting began to move.

name: Milcery
entry_sword: This Pokémon was born from sweet-smelling particles in the air. Its body is made of cream.

name: Alcremie
entry_sword: When it trusts a Trainer, it will treat them to berries it’s decorated with cream.

name: Falinks
entry_sword: Five of them are troopers, and one is the brass. The brass’s orders are absolute.

name: Pincurchin
entry_sword: It feeds on seaweed, using its teeth to scrape it off rocks. Electric current flows from the tips of its spines.

name: Snom
entry_sword: It spits out thread imbued with a frigid sort of energy and uses it to tie its body to branches, disguising itself as an icicle while it sleeps.

name: Frosmoth
entry_sword: Icy scales fall from its wings like snow as it flies over fields and mountains. The temperature of its wings is less than −290 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Stonjourner
entry_sword: It stands in grasslands, watching the sun’s descent from zenith to horizon. This Pokémon has a talent for delivering dynamic kicks.

name: Eiscue Ice
entry_sword: It drifted in on the flow of ocean waters from a frigid place. It keeps its head iced constantly to make sure it stays nice and cold.

name: Indeedee Male
entry_sword: It uses the horns on its head to sense the emotions of others. Males will act as valets for those they serve, looking after their every need.

name: Morpeko Full Belly
entry_sword: As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It’s also generating electricity.

name: Cufant
entry_sword: It digs up the ground with its trunk. It’s also very strong, being able to carry loads of over five tons without any problem at all.

name: Copperajah
entry_sword: They came over from another region long ago and worked together with humans. Their green skin is resistant to water.

name: Dracozolt
entry_sword: In ancient times, it was unbeatable thanks to its powerful lower body, but it went extinct anyway after it depleted all its plant-based food sources.

name: Arctozolt
entry_sword: The shaking of its freezing upper half is what generates its electricity. It has a hard time walking around.

name: Dracovish
abilities: Water Absorb, Strong Jaw, Sand Rush
entry_sword: Powerful legs and jaws made it the apex predator of its time. Its own overhunting of its prey was what drove it to extinction.

name: Arctovish
abilities: Water Absorb, Ice Body, Slush Rush
entry_sword: Though it’s able to capture prey by freezing its surroundings, it has trouble eating the prey afterward because its mouth is on top of its head.

name: Duraludon
entry_sword: Its body resembles polished metal, and it’s both lightweight and strong. The only drawback is that it rusts easily.

name: Dreepy
entry_sword: After being reborn as a ghost Pokémon, Dreepy wanders the areas it used to inhabit back when it was alive in prehistoric seas.

name: Drakloak
entry_sword: It’s capable of flying faster than 120 mph. It battles alongside Dreepy and dotes on them until they successfully evolve.

name: Dragapult
entry_sword: When it isn’t battling, it keeps Dreepy in the holes on its horns. Once a fight starts, it launches the Dreepy like supersonic missiles.

name: Zacian
entry_sword: Known as a legendary hero, this Pokémon absorbs metal particles, transforming them into a weapon it uses to battle.

name: Zamazenta
entry_sword: In times past, it worked together with a king of the people to save the Galar region. It absorbs metal that it then uses in battle.

name: Eternatus
entry_sword: The core on its chest absorbs energy emanating from the lands of the Galar region. This energy is what allows Eternatus to stay active.

name: Kubfu
entry_sword: Kubfu trains hard to perfect its moves. The moves it masters will determine which form it takes when it evolves.

name: Urshifu Single Strike
entry_sword: This form of Urshifu is a strong believer in the one-hit KO. Its strategy is to leap in close to foes and land a devastating blow with a hardened fist.

name: Zarude
entry_sword: Within dense forests, this Pokémon lives in a pack with others of its kind. It’s incredibly aggressive, and the other Pokémon of the forest fear it.

name: Regieleki
entry_sword: This Pokémon is a cluster of electrical energy. It’s said that removing the rings on Regieleki’s body will unleash the Pokémon’s latent power.

name: Regidrago
entry_sword: An academic theory proposes that Regidrago’s arms were once the head of an ancient dragon Pokémon. The theory remains unproven.

name: Glastrier
entry_sword: Glastrier emits intense cold from its hooves. It’s also a belligerent Pokémon—anything it wants, it takes by force.

name: Spectrier
entry_sword: It probes its surroundings with all its senses save one—it doesn’t use its sense of sight. Spectrier’s kicks are said to separate soul from body.

name: Calyrex
entry_sword: Calyrex is a merciful Pokémon, capable of providing healing and blessings. It reigned over the Galar region in times of yore.

name: Sprigatito
entry_scarlet: Its fluffy fur is similar in composition to plants. This Pokémon frequently washes its face to keep it from drying out.

name: Floragato
entry_scarlet: Floragato deftly wields the vine hidden beneath its long fur, slamming the hard flower bud against its opponents.

name: Meowscarada
entry_scarlet: This Pokémon uses the reflective fur lining its cape to camouflage the stem of its flower, creating the illusion that the flower is floating.

name: Fuecoco
entry_scarlet: It lies on warm rocks and uses the heat absorbed by its square-shaped scales to create fire energy.

name: Crocalor
entry_scarlet: The combination of Crocalor’s fire energy and overflowing vitality has caused an egg-shaped fireball to appear on the Pokémon’s head.

name: Skeledirge
entry_scarlet: The fiery bird changes shape when Skeledirge sings. Rumor has it that the bird was born when the fireball on Skeledirge’s head gained a soul.

name: Quaxly
entry_scarlet: This Pokémon migrated to Paldea from distant lands long ago. The gel secreted by its feathers repels water and grime."

name: Quaxwell
entry_scarlet: These Pokémon constantly run through shallow waters to train their legs, then compete with each other to see which of them kicks most gracefully.

name: Quaquaval
